  • Wir machen flexibles und mobiles Arbeiten möglich: Egal ob im Büro, zu Hause, unterwegs oder während einer Workation
  • Werden Sie Teil des einzigartigen CBRE-Spirits und profitieren Sie von schnellen Entscheidungswegen und Duz-Kultur
  • Bleiben Sie mobil mit unserem Fahrtkostenzuschuss zum ÖPNV
  • Durch das offene high-end Bürokonzept leben wir täglich unsere Unternehmenskultur auf Augenhöhe
  • Erfolge zusammen feiern! Dafür gibt es Gelegenheit bei regelmäßigen Team-Events
  • Profitieren Sie von weiteren Benefits wie Familienservice, Corporate Benefits, Betriebliche Altersvorsorge, Sonderkonditionen für Fitnessstudios, JobRad u.v.m

MACHEN SIE MIT?

Werden Sie Teil unserer Erfolgsgeschichte! - Wir freuen uns über Ihre Bewerbung als Data Analyst (m/w/d) über unser Online-Bewerbungssystem, inklusive Lebenslauf, Anschreiben und relevanten Zeugnissen.

Bitte beachten Sie, dass wir aus Datenschutzgründen leider keine Bewerbungen per E-Mail annehmen können.

Bei Rückfragen zur Stellenanzeige wenden Sie sich gerne per E-Mail an unser Talent Acquisition Team: bewerbung@cbre.com

Title: Senior Data Analyst (f/m/d)
Description:
Founded in 2008, BMG has become the fourth-largest music company worldwide. Our success and competitive edge are rooted in our founding values of fairness, transparency, and service. Our mission is clear: to empower artists and songwriters to maximize the potential of their songs and recordings in the digital era.

BMG’s Global Data Analytics is our central data unit, spanning a close-knit international team of experienced Analytics Engineers, Data Analysts and Data Scientists across Germany, the US and the UK. We’re transforming how music works, enabling operational stakeholders to make data-driven decisions as well as driving strategic growth, based on a modern data stack.

 

We are currently seeking a motivated Senior Data Analyst (f/m/d) to join our headquarters in Berlin. This position is a maternity cover, initially expected to last until end of April 2026. As an experienced Data Analyst, you will collaborate with senior stakeholders of various departments to facilitate informed decision-making through novel data insights, compelling storytelling, and advanced data visualization. Join us in shaping the future of music analytics!

 

What You’ll Be Doing


Process big data volumes, modelling and transforming data (using dbt) from centralized DWHs (Google BigQuery) and external/organizational databases to build strategic analyses and operational KPIs
Utilize data visualization to support decision-making, crafting compelling (Looker) dashboards for key business stakeholders (e.g. Investments, Artist & Repertoire, Marketing, Streaming Sales, Rights & Royalties, Operations)
Develop scalable self-service reporting solutions and address diverse ad-hoc requests that transform our business
Collaborate closely with our global team and international colleagues to foster a data-driven culture by proposing innovative initiatives and building actionable data products


What You Bring


Degree in Computer Science, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, or related field
Profound experience in data analytics, ideally with large datasets
Excellent SQL skills and good knowledge of Python
Proficiency in data visualization tools, such as Looker or Tableau
Broad understanding of data analysis methods and storytelling
Results-driven and analytical character, with a strategic mindset to derive business insights
Effective communication skills - confident in presenting findings to senior management
Ability to build relationships with stakeholders to understand business needs and data consumer needs
Capability to plan and implement projects independently
Comfortable working in a global, fast-paced and dynamic environment


It’s also a plus if you have…


Prior music industry experience
Experience with GCP, dbt and Git/Bitbucket
Knowledge of Jira and Confluence
Understanding of statistical methods and ML


What We Offer


A modern office in the heart of Berlin and flexible options for remote work
Numerous benefits such as a free BVG job ticket, a reduced-price membership for Urban Sports, company bike leasing, discounts for Bertelsmann employees, among others
Ongoing training opportunities on our internal platforms BMG Campus and Bertelsmann University
Long-term career opportunities for all employees
A collaborative work environment with an open, appreciative community of people who all share the same passion for working with artists and songwriters
Our unique corporate culture based on strong values and mutual support that make us a great team


This is us

As the great Kurt Cobain once said, "Come as you are." BMG is committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all employees. We value diversity in all forms. Equal opportunity is deeply rooted in our core value of fairness, and we are committed to creating a truly inclusive work environment where everyone can thrive. If you're good at what you do, come as you are! Whether you're an experienced professional or just starting out, we welcome you to join our team.

All applicants to BMG are treated equally - regardless of age, disability, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy or parenthood, ethnic origin, color, nationality, religion or belief.

(BMG is publishing Kurt Cobain's catalog, including the 1992 single 'Come As You Are.')

HTML:
Founded in 2008, BMG has become the fourth-largest music company worldwide. Our success and competitive edge are rooted in our founding values of fairness, transparency, and service. Our mission is clear: to empower artists and songwriters to maximize the potential of their songs and recordings in the digital era.

BMG’s Global Data Analytics is our central data unit, spanning a close-knit international team of experienced Analytics Engineers, Data Analysts and Data Scientists across Germany, the US and the UK. We’re transforming how music works, enabling operational stakeholders to make data-driven decisions as well as driving strategic growth, based on a modern data stack.

 

We are currently seeking a motivated Senior Data Analyst (f/m/d) to join our headquarters in Berlin. This position is a maternity cover, initially expected to last until end of April 2026. As an experienced Data Analyst, you will collaborate with senior stakeholders of various departments to facilitate informed decision-making through novel data insights, compelling storytelling, and advanced data visualization. Join us in shaping the future of music analytics!

 

What You’ll Be Doing

  • Process big data volumes, modelling and transforming data (using dbt) from centralized DWHs (Google BigQuery) and external/organizational databases to build strategic analyses and operational KPIs
  • Utilize data visualization to support decision-making, crafting compelling (Looker) dashboards for key business stakeholders (e.g. Investments, Artist & Repertoire, Marketing, Streaming Sales, Rights & Royalties, Operations)
  • Develop scalable self-service reporting solutions and address diverse ad-hoc requests that transform our business
  • Collaborate closely with our global team and international colleagues to foster a data-driven culture by proposing innovative initiatives and building actionable data products

What You Bring

  • Degree in Computer Science, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, or related field
  • Profound experience in data analytics, ideally with large datasets
  • Excellent SQL skills and good knowledge of Python
  • Proficiency in data visualization tools, such as Looker or Tableau
  • Broad understanding of data analysis methods and storytelling
  • Results-driven and analytical character, with a strategic mindset to derive business insights
  • Effective communication skills - confident in presenting findings to senior management
  • Ability to build relationships with stakeholders to understand business needs and data consumer needs
  • Capability to plan and implement projects independently
  • Comfortable working in a global, fast-paced and dynamic environment

It’s also a plus if you have…

  • Prior music industry experience
  • Experience with GCP, dbt and Git/Bitbucket
  • Knowledge of Jira and Confluence
  • Understanding of statistical methods and ML

What We Offer

  • A modern office in the heart of Berlin and flexible options for remote work
  • Numerous benefits such as a free BVG job ticket, a reduced-price membership for Urban Sports, company bike leasing, discounts for Bertelsmann employees, among others
  • Ongoing training opportunities on our internal platforms BMG Campus and Bertelsmann University
  • Long-term career opportunities for all employees
  • A collaborative work environment with an open, appreciative community of people who all share the same passion for working with artists and songwriters
  • Our unique corporate culture based on strong values and mutual support that make us a great team

This is us

As the great Kurt Cobain once said, "Come as you are." BMG is committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all employees. We value diversity in all forms. Equal opportunity is deeply rooted in our core value of fairness, and we are committed to creating a truly inclusive work environment where everyone can thrive. If you're good at what you do, come as you are! Whether you're an experienced professional or just starting out, we welcome you to join our team.

All applicants to BMG are treated equally - regardless of age, disability, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy or parenthood, ethnic origin, color, nationality, religion or belief.

(BMG is publishing Kurt Cobain's catalog, including the 1992 single 'Come As You Are.')

Title: Data Accuracy Intern / Working Student
Description:
Your role

In This Role You Will


Leverage artificial intelligence to drive operational excellence in our customers
Learn the functioning of our computer vision model and assist the product team in the continuous enhancement of its performance
Work closely with our consulting and technical teams to actively identify solutions to increase efficiency, improve ergonomics, and reduce costs within our customers’ manufacturing processes
Create and maintain process documentation and standards using Deltia’s AI software


Your profile

Requirements


Enrolled or recently graduate from a Bachelor's or Master’s program in Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science, Engineering or a related field
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to interact effectively with team members and clients
Dedication and drive in solving customer problems
Strong analytical skills
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, especially Excel for data analysis
Fluent written and spoken English skills; German is a plus


Nice to have


1+ years of experience in a startup or consultancy environment
Experience in analyzing and optimizing business processes
Experience in the manufacturing industry is an advantage, but not essential
Experience with Python or R is a plus


What we offer


A paid internship or working student position
Be on the forefront in defining what artificial intelligence means in manufacturing
Gain hands-on experience in working in an AI-first software company
The option to work in a brand new office situated on the AI Campus in Berlin where we closely cooperate with other exciting AI ventures
Work remotely from anywhere in Europe
Supportive and inclusive culture that values diversity and promotes the advancement of underrepresented groups within the company
Collaborate with a diverse (currently more than 10 nationalities) and talented team, working on cutting-edge projects with real-world impact
Network with professionals and leaders in the field, opening doors to potential future career opportunities
Ethics⚖️: We are committed to developing ethical AI software


Apply for this job

About Us

We're a dynamic AI startup reshaping manufacturing with advanced tech like computer vision and AI. Our mission? Empower workers to boost productivity using cutting-edge tools. Starting with assembly processes, we'll expand to logistics and more.

Led by Max, who digitized 40 factories, and Silviu, a computer vision expert, our team includes top talent from ETH, MIT, and industry leaders. We value hard work, creativity, and diversity. Backed by Merantix and Cavalry, we offer comprehensive benefits, flexible schedules, and a supportive work environment.

Join us on the Berlin AI Campus, part of a vibrant ecosystem of engineers and entrepreneurs from top universities worldwide.

Title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst (w/m/d)
Description:
Company Description

At Enpal, we are pursuing the dream of building the largest renewable community in Europe. How do we make that happen? Enpal finally simplifies providing solar energy: We rent out solar systems, electricity storage, and wall boxes at an all-inclusive rate, supplemented by a favorable green electricity tariff; all intelligently connected to form an integrated overall solution. True to the motto "digital, decentralized, and 100% renewable", our heart beats both for the rapid development of a company and for combating the greatest challenge of our generation - climate change.

Job Description


Work closely with the Heat Pump division stakeholders to design, build, and maintain automated data pipelines and ensure the best-in-class reporting infrastructure.
Implement and maintain automated Reporting for different business units to provide visibility and performance tracking across segments.
Develop deep knowledge of customer journey processes and use it to empower the business stakeholders to optimize the conversion funnel and achieve operational excellence.



Qualifications


5+ years of relevant experience in business intelligence, data analytics or similar roles.
Enthusiasm for working in dynamic, rapidly changing environments.
Strong ability to analyse data, identify patterns, and communicate. technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a proven track record in automating data pipelines.
Exposure to Python for data analysis (e.g. pandas).
Our BI stack includes Snowflake, Streamlit, Tableau and dbt. Familiarity with the two latter ones is required/desired.
High proficiency in SQL and ETL processes.



Additional Information


The chance to be part of a fast-growing and future-oriented startup: we are one of the biggest players in the solar business.
A hybrid work model, the ability to come to our Berlin office every now and then for in person discussions and events, or to be there all the time - you decide.
Work with the best in the industry and grow with us: there’s plenty of room for your ideas.
Help to make the world a bit better: we are all about green energy.



At Enpal, we are proud of the diversity of our team. No decisions are made based on skin color, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or age, either during recruitment or employment. We strongly encourage women, neurodivergent people, people of color, and LGBTQ(+) people to apply. Enpal stands for a safe workplace and takes action against discrimination and harassment of any kind.

Title: GIS Analyst - Berlin - Up to €75,000K
Description:
Overview:




We are on the hunt for a talented GIS Analyst to join an innovative team in Germany. This role is your chance to lead the charge in renewable energy projects, focusing on wind, solar, and hydropower developments. As a GIS Analyst, you’ll be instrumental in identifying optimal project sites, evaluating environmental impacts, and managing crucial geospatial data, all while collaborating with a multidisciplinary team to shape a sustainable future.




Key Duties:

As a GIS Analyst you will conduct geospatial analyses to identify optimal sites for renewable energy projects.
Manage, organize, and maintain geospatial datasets (environmental, topographical, and infrastructural).
Perform site suitability assessments, incorporating land use, environmental regulations, and grid proximity.
Create high-quality maps, visualizations, and reports for stakeholder communications.
Integrate GIS data into technical models, project plans, and environmental impact assessments.
Plan and oversee field surveys and data collection efforts.
Develop and maintain GIS databases, ensuring data quality and accessibility.
Engage with stakeholders, including regulatory agencies and landowners, to address project concerns.




Requirements:




Bachelor’s degree in Geography, Geospatial Sciences, Environmental Science, or a related field.
2–4 years of experience as a GIS Analyst, ideally in renewable energy or related sectors.
Proficiency in GIS software (ArcGIS, QGIS) and geospatial visualization tools.
Strong understanding of environmental regulations in Germany and land-use planning.
Familiarity with geospatial data formats (e.g., shapefiles, geodatabases, CAD).
Excellent problem-solving, analytical, and project management skills.
Effective communicator capable of presenting technical information to diverse audiences.




Desirables:




Experience with remote sensing techniques and spatial databases (e.g., PostgreSQL/PostGIS).
Skills in scripting languages like Python for geospatial data processing.
Background in renewable energy project development.




Benefits:




As a GIS Anaylst, you will be part of a team driving sustainable change in the renewable energy sector.
Work on impactful projects with clear opportunities for career growth and progression.
Collaborate with experts in engineering, environmental sciences, and project management.
Competitive salary and a role that directly contributes to Net Zero goals.




Please get in touch if you are interested in applying for GIS Analyst role.

Title: Online Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.

A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:

In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.

Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

TELUS Digital AI Community

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.





Qualification Path

This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreemen

Title: Marketing Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
At FORMEL SKIN, we're at the forefront of revolutionizing dermatology and reshaping the landscape of healthcare. Our mission is to establish a global online dermatology clinic, making highly effective dermatological treatments easily accessible to all. We've made significant strides, garnering support from some of Europe's most prominent health and consumer investors. Notably, in December 2021, we achieved a significant milestone by raising €30 million in Germany's largest health tech Series A round.

To date, we've successfully provided over one million treatments to our patients. Our dynamic team is passionate, ambitious, and brings a wealth of experience from successful health and consumer tech ventures. Based in Berlin, a city known for its vibrancy, we're committed to expanding our reach and impact, offering you the opportunity to be part of our exciting journey.

As a Marketing Data Analyst (m/f/d) at FORMEL SKIN, you will take ownership of marketing analytics, playing a crucial role in driving our marketing strategies and business growth. Your work will shape data-driven decisions and optimize performance across all marketing channels.

What you’ll be doing


Marketing Analytics Ownership: Lead all marketing analytics initiatives, designing and developing comprehensive marketing reporting systems. Ensure timely and actionable insights for stakeholders.
Data-Driven Marketing Initiatives: Collaborate with the marketing team, channel owners, data engineers, and others to analyze campaign performance and implement data-driven strategies.
Data Collection and Decision-Making: Define data collection and processing requirements. Promote a culture of data-driven decision-making across the marketing department.
Web Analytics Management: Own web tracking and analytics tools (Google Analytics, GTM, Amplitude), ensuring optimal setup and functionality.
Deep Data Analysis: Conduct in-depth analyses to identify trends, insights, and opportunities to enhance marketing performance.
Stakeholder Collaboration: Work across departments to ensure that marketing analytics initiatives align with business goals and KPIs.


What you need to shine


Experience: At least 3+ years of experience as a Marketing Analyst, ideally in a startup environment. You have a proven track record of leveraging data-driven insights to shape marketing strategies and improve campaign performance.
Marketing Expertise: Strong understanding of B2C marketing concepts, customer journey analysis, and the role of various channels in driving growth and engagement.
Technical Proficiency: Solid skills in SQL and cloud analytical databases (e.g., BigQuery, Redshift, Snowflake). Familiarity with Python for advanced data analysis is a plus.
Data Visualization and Reporting: Proficiency with tools like Tableau to create compelling reports and translate complex data into actionable insights for stakeholders.
Analytical Mindset: Strong problem-solving and analytical abilities to identify trends, diagnose issues, and propose solutions that align with business goals.
Self-Organization and Project Management Skills: Ability to manage tasks effectively, ensuring they are completed on time and meet business requirements.
Collaboration Skills: Comfortable working with cross-functional teams, including marketing, engineering, and data professionals. Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.
Language Proficiency: Fluent in English with strong verbal and written communication skills. German is a plus but not required.


Why work with us?


A great opportunity to advance your career in marketing analytics: Join a growing, innovative company where your expertise will directly influence marketing strategies and business growth.
Benefits you can enjoy:
28 days vacation,
NAVIT or Urban Sports Club memberships, employee discounts,
a professional development budget,
hybrid work set up (2 home office days per week),
remote work possibility (up to 4 weeks per year within the EU).
Building a great team together: At FORMEL SKIN, we believe that building a great team and fostering strong interpersonal relationships are fundamental to our success. If you're passionate about collaborating with like-minded individuals, you'll appreciate our approach, which includes regular company events, a team event budget, and bonuses for employee referrals.

About Us

With FORMEL SKIN, we are building Germany's leading dermatological platform to provide patients with all skin problems immediate access to personalised medical treatments. Our team of experienced doctors, pharmacists and innovators work hard to treat, guide and support patients throughout their skin health journey. As a medical brand, we focus on clear and fast communication with our patients, confidence backed by our medical expertise and vast experience and commitment to everything we do. It is our mission to make dermatological care accessible to everyone - no matter how big or small the skin issue might be.

Just as we seek to build out an inclusive dermatology service, we seek to build an inclusive workplace with exceptional individuals committed to a shared mission. FORMEL SKIN is an equal opportunity employer. We therefore welcome everyone to apply: people of any race, ethnicity, nationality and religion, LGBTQAI+ folks, individuals with disabilities (both seen and unseen), people of any age, or family status.
Show more
HTML:
At FORMEL SKIN, we're at the forefront of revolutionizing dermatology and reshaping the landscape of healthcare. Our mission is to establish a global online dermatology clinic, making highly effective dermatological treatments easily accessible to all. We've made significant strides, garnering support from some of Europe's most prominent health and consumer investors. Notably, in December 2021, we achieved a significant milestone by raising €30 million in Germany's largest health tech Series A round.

To date, we've successfully provided over one million treatments to our patients. Our dynamic team is passionate, ambitious, and brings a wealth of experience from successful health and consumer tech ventures. Based in Berlin, a city known for its vibrancy, we're committed to expanding our reach and impact, offering you the opportunity to be part of our exciting journey.

As a Marketing Data Analyst (m/f/d) at FORMEL SKIN, you will take ownership of marketing analytics, playing a crucial role in driving our marketing strategies and business growth. Your work will shape data-driven decisions and optimize performance across all marketing channels.

What you’ll be doing

  • Marketing Analytics Ownership: Lead all marketing analytics initiatives, designing and developing comprehensive marketing reporting systems. Ensure timely and actionable insights for stakeholders.
  • Data-Driven Marketing Initiatives: Collaborate with the marketing team, channel owners, data engineers, and others to analyze campaign performance and implement data-driven strategies.
  • Data Collection and Decision-Making: Define data collection and processing requirements. Promote a culture of data-driven decision-making across the marketing department.
  • Web Analytics Management: Own web tracking and analytics tools (Google Analytics, GTM, Amplitude), ensuring optimal setup and functionality.
  • Deep Data Analysis: Conduct in-depth analyses to identify trends, insights, and opportunities to enhance marketing performance.
  • Stakeholder Collaboration: Work across departments to ensure that marketing analytics initiatives align with business goals and KPIs.

What you need to shine

  • Experience: At least 3+ years of experience as a Marketing Analyst, ideally in a startup environment. You have a proven track record of leveraging data-driven insights to shape marketing strategies and improve campaign performance.
  • Marketing Expertise: Strong understanding of B2C marketing concepts, customer journey analysis, and the role of various channels in driving growth and engagement.
  • Technical Proficiency: Solid skills in SQL and cloud analytical databases (e.g., BigQuery, Redshift, Snowflake). Familiarity with Python for advanced data analysis is a plus.
  • Data Visualization and Reporting: Proficiency with tools like Tableau to create compelling reports and translate complex data into actionable insights for stakeholders.
  • Analytical Mindset: Strong problem-solving and analytical abilities to identify trends, diagnose issues, and propose solutions that align with business goals.
  • Self-Organization and Project Management Skills: Ability to manage tasks effectively, ensuring they are completed on time and meet business requirements.
  • Collaboration Skills: Comfortable working with cross-functional teams, including marketing, engineering, and data professionals. Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.
  • Language Proficiency: Fluent in English with strong verbal and written communication skills. German is a plus but not required.

Why work with us?

  • A great opportunity to advance your career in marketing analytics: Join a growing, innovative company where your expertise will directly influence marketing strategies and business growth.
  • Benefits you can enjoy:
    • 28 days vacation,
    • NAVIT or Urban Sports Club memberships, employee discounts,
    • a professional development budget,
    • hybrid work set up (2 home office days per week),
    • remote work possibility (up to 4 weeks per year within the EU).
  • Building a great team together: At FORMEL SKIN, we believe that building a great team and fostering strong interpersonal relationships are fundamental to our success. If you're passionate about collaborating with like-minded individuals, you'll appreciate our approach, which includes regular company events, a team event budget, and bonuses for employee referrals.
About Us

With FORMEL SKIN, we are building Germany's leading dermatological platform to provide patients with all skin problems immediate access to personalised medical treatments. Our team of experienced doctors, pharmacists and innovators work hard to treat, guide and support patients throughout their skin health journey. As a medical brand, we focus on clear and fast communication with our patients, confidence backed by our medical expertise and vast experience and commitment to everything we do. It is our mission to make dermatological care accessible to everyone - no matter how big or small the skin issue might be.

Just as we seek to build out an inclusive dermatology service, we seek to build an inclusive workplace with exceptional individuals committed to a shared mission. FORMEL SKIN is an equal opportunity employer. We therefore welcome everyone to apply: people of any race, ethnicity, nationality and religion, LGBTQAI+ folks, individuals with disabilities (both seen and unseen), people of any age, or family status.

Title: Open Application
Description:
Founded in 2020, Y42 is a fast-growing company of70+ambitious and dedicated experts from all over the world who are on a mission to reshape the data space. We are backed by some of the world’s most renowned investors, having raised $34m in funding (Series A + seed round). This enabled us to build one of the largest tech and product teams across all European Series A-funded startups with 50+team members.

We work together to create an environment for people with open minds who want to grow and have an impact. Being a part of Y42 means constant growth and opportunity. We are all highly ambitious yet united in our mission to succeed as a team. Here, you can truly explore and redefine your own potential. We believe it is crucial for everyone here to find purpose in what they do, thrive, and feel like they belong. That is why we invite you to

Joining Y42 means joining our mission and contributing to our growth. A lot of what we are doing is unexplored, which means that you will find yourself doing things you haven’t done before. You might just discover skills you didn’t know you had.

People who are eager to reach their full potential can use this environment as a professional playground and become the most excellent version of themselves!

If this speaks to you, we strongly encourage you to send us an unsolicited application and let us know how you picture yourself contributing to the Y42 story and why. We will carefully check for any upcoming projects or challenges and get back to you with feedback.

About You

It doesn't matter whether you're still in school or have already held C-level positions. We have created entirely new roles for some of our wonderful talents in the past, and we will continue to do so. Everyone carries a unique set of valuable skills and experiences.

The typical hiring process at Y42:

Application review

Screening call

Interview with hiring manager

Cultural fit interview

Reference check

Offer

As soon as a suitable role becomes available, we will reach out to you. To make this process faster, we would like to know a few things about you.

Title: Senior Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Our mission? Making day-to-day banking easier for SMEs and freelancers thanks to an online business account that's combined with invoicing, bookkeeping and spend management tools. Thanks to its innovative product, highly reactive 24/7 customer support and clear pricing, Qonto has become the leader in its market.

Our journey: Founded by Alexandre and Steve in July 2017, Qonto has rapidly gained trust, serving over 500,000 customers. Thanks to our wonderful team of 1,600+ Qontoers, we also made it to the LinkedIn Top Companies French ranking!

Our values:

Customer focus | Prioritize customers in everything you do

Ownership | Own your part, get things done

Teamwork | Make (team)work easy

Mastery | Continuously raise the bar

Integrity | Always do what’s right, and respect people

Our beliefs: At Qonto, we're committed to fostering a welcoming environment where everyone can thrive. We prioritize evaluating applicants based solely on skills and potential, ensuring diversity with 50% international team members, 44% women, and 20% parents. Join us in building a workplace that celebrates diversity and individuality.

Discover the steps we took to create a discrimination-free hiring process .

Growth Data Analyst

Shape the Future of European Business Banking

Transform raw data into growth strategies that impact businesses across Europe

Our Mission:

At Qonto, we're revolutionizing business banking for SMEs and freelancers across Europe. Data isn't just numbers to us - it's the cornerstone of our decision-making and the fuel for our rapid growth. As our Marketing Data Analyst, you'll be at the intersection of data and business strategy, directly influencing how we expand our footprint in the European market.

👩‍💻🧑‍💻Your Impact:

Join our team of data analysts where you'll:


Drive Qonto's expansion strategy through data-driven insights
Uncover growth opportunities that could impact thousands of businesses
Partner with stakeholders across Spain, France, Serbia, and Germany to shape our European success story.
Be part of a dynamic BI organization that's central to Qonto's strategic decisions


🎯 Your Key Missions:


Strategic Performance Monitoring: Design and implement sophisticated monitoring systems that track our growth trajectory and spot opportunities
Growth Detective: Lead investigations into performance patterns, transforming data anomalies into actionable acquisition strategies
Analytics Democratization: Create intuitive self-service analytics tools that empower our growth team to make data-driven decisions
Strategic Partnership: Be the trusted data advisor to our growth department, challenging assumptions and driving data-informed strategies
Quality Champion: Help set new standards for analytics excellence, ensuring our insights are both powerful and reliable


👥 The Team Experience:


Work alongside a diverse, international team of five growth experts spread across Europe
Learn from various experience levels, including staff members and senior analysts
Enjoy a culture that values autonomy, quick learning, and strong relationships
Tackle exciting challenges that require creative problem-solving and innovative thinking


🤝 Your Future Manager: Omar

Meet Omar, our Lead Data Analyst who:


Built Qonto's analytics team from 4 to 25 talented individuals
Brings rich experience from airline revenue management and ad tech industries
Is passionate about mentoring and developing data talent
Will help you grow both technically and strategically in your role


🏅 What Makes You Stand Out:


Analytical Prowess: You have a proven track record in growth analytics, particularly in areas like onboarding or website analytics
Business Acumen: You don't just crunch numbers - you understand the business implications behind them
Technical Excellence: You're proficient in Python, SQL, and Tableau, with an eagerness to expand your technical toolkit
Communication: You can translate complex data insights into clear, actionable recommendations
Innovation Mindset: You're excited about finding creative solutions to complex data challenges
Statistical Thinking: You can distinguish meaningful patterns from statistical noise


♟️ Why This Role Matters:


Direct impact on Qonto's European expansion strategy
Opportunity to work with cutting-edge analytics tools and methodologies
Chance to shape the future of business banking
Work in a fast-growing scale-up that values data-driven decision-making


Diversity & Inclusion:

At Qonto, diversity isn't a checkbox - it's our strength. We believe the best teams are built on different perspectives, experiences, and backgrounds. We encourage applications from everyone who feels they can contribute to our mission, regardless of traditional qualifications.

🏆 What We Offer:


Work with a purpose: Help transform business banking across Europe
Growth opportunities: Learn from experienced data leaders and tackle complex challenges
International exposure: Collaborate with teams across multiple European markets
Innovation culture: Be part of a team that's pushing the boundaries of fintech


At Qonto we understand that true diversity isn't just about ticking boxes on a hiring checklist. Apply regardless of the boxes you tick! Who knows? You may have the missing piece of the puzzle we've been searching for all along.

🎁 Perks

A tailor-made and dynamic career track. An inclusive work environment. And so much more to help you succeed.


Offices in Paris, Berlin, Milan, Barcelona, and Belgrade;
Tailor-made remote work policy depending on the job you apply for and where you live;
Competitive salary package;
A meal voucher;
Public transportation reimbursement (part or global);
A great health insurance (depending on the country);
Employee well-being initiatives: access to Moka Care to take care of your mental health and great offers for sports and wellness activities;
A progressive disability and parenthood policy (1 in 6 of Qonto employees is a parent!) and childcare benefits with selected partners;
Monthly team events.


💪 Our hiring process:


Interviews with your Talent Acquisition Manager and future managers
A remote exercise to demonstrate your skills and give you a taste of what working at Qonto could be like


We will send you an interview guide so you can best prepare yourself.

On average, our process lasts 20 working days and offers usually follow within 48 hours 🤞

To learn more about us:

Qonto's Blog | Les Échos I L'Usine Digitale | Courrier Cadres

To know how your personal data will be processed during your application process or to request its deletion, please click here .

At Qonto we understand that true diversity isn't just about ticking boxes on a hiring checklist. Apply regardless of the boxes you tick! Who knows? You may have the missing piece of the puzzle we've been searching for all along.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Founded in 2008, BMG has become the fourth-largest music company worldwide. Our success and competitive edge are rooted in our founding values of fairness, transparency, and service. Our mission is clear: to empower artists and songwriters to maximize the potential of their songs and recordings in the digital era.




BMG’s Global Data Analytics is our central data unit, spanning a close-knit international team of experienced Analytics Engineers, Data Analysts and Data Scientists across Germany, the US and the UK. We’re transforming how music works, enabling operational stakeholders to make data-driven decisions as well as driving strategic growth, based on a modern data stack.




We are currently seeking a motivated Senior Data Analyst (f/m/d) to join our headquarters in Berlin. This position is a maternity cover, initially expected to last until end of April 2026. As an experienced Data Analyst, you will collaborate with senior stakeholders of various departments to facilitate informed decision-making through novel data insights, compelling storytelling, and advanced data visualization. Join us in shaping the future of music analytics!




What you’ll be doing

Process big data volumes, modelling and transforming data (using dbt) from centralized DWHs (Google BigQuery) and external/organizational databases to build strategic analyses and operational KPIs
Utilize data visualization to support decision-making, crafting compelling (Looker) dashboards for key business stakeholders (e.g. Investments, Artist & Repertoire, Marketing, Streaming Sales, Rights & Royalties, Operations)
Develop scalable self-service reporting solutions and address diverse ad-hoc requests that transform our business
Collaborate closely with our global team and international colleagues to foster a data-driven culture by proposing innovative initiatives and building actionable data products




What you bring

Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, or related field
Profound experience in data analytics, ideally with large datasets
Excellent SQL skills and good knowledge of Python
Proficiency in data visualization tools, such as Looker or Tableau
Broad understanding of data analysis methods and storytelling
Results-driven and analytical character, with a strategic mindset to derive business insights
Effective communication skills - confident in presenting findings to senior management
Ability to build relationships with stakeholders to understand business needs and data consumer needs
Capability to plan and implement projects independently
Comfortable working in a global, fast-paced and dynamic environment




It’s also a plus if you have…

Prior music industry experience
Experience with GCP, dbt and Git/Bitbucket
Knowledge of Jira and Confluence
Understanding of statistical methods and ML




What we offer

A modern office in the heart of Berlin and flexible options for remote work
Numerous benefits such as a free BVG job ticket, a reduced-price membership for Urban Sports, company bike leasing, discounts for Bertelsmann employees, among others
Ongoing training opportunities on our internal platforms BMG Campus and Bertelsmann University
Long-term career opportunities for all employees
A collaborative work environment with an open, appreciative community of people who all share the same passion for working with artists and songwriters
Our unique corporate culture based on strong values and mutual support that make us a great team




This is us

As the great Kurt Cobain once said, "Come as you are." BMG is committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all employees. We value diversity in all forms. Equal opportunity is deeply rooted in our core value of fairness, and we are committed to creating a truly inclusive work environment where everyone can thrive. If you're good at what you do, come as you are! Whether you're an experienced professional or just starting out, we welcome you to join our team.

All applicants to BMG are treated equally - regardless of age, disability, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy or parenthood, ethnic origin, color, nationality, religion or belief.

(BMG is publishing Kurt Cobain's catalog, including the 1992 single 'Come As You Are.')

Show more

Title: Data Analyst (w/m/d)
Description:
We are Billie, the leading provider of Buy Now, Pay Later (BNPL) payment methods for businesses, offering B2B companies innovative digital payment services and modern checkout solutions. We are to create a new standard for business payments and have made it our mission to simplify the purchasing experience for all businesses making it a tool for growth. Our solutions are based on proprietary, machine-learning-supported risk models, fully digitized processes and a highly scalable tech platform. This makes us a deep-tech company building financial products, not the other way around. We love building simple and elegant solutions and we strive for automation and scalability.

About The Role

Billie’s Analytics team is at the heart of the company supporting multiple functions to make data-driven decisions. Analytics team works closely with all Product segments, and other departments by innovating, hypothesizing, strategizing and providing recommended actions to relevant stakeholders (Decision science, Business Development and Account Management, Collection and Underwriting teams, Customer support and Marketing) in an integrated, scalable, secure and compliant way to enable the company's sustainable growth.

In this role, you will have the chance to make a significant impact by leveraging data and analytics tools, will look for solutions, establish relationships to be able to guide business decisions within the company values and expectations, and contribute to the ongoing growth of our portfolio.

The role is for someone who is a self-starter, enjoys exploring data for insights to support strategic decision making, is passionate about building data structures, analyzing and reporting on key performance indicators, comfortable to work on operational matters, willing to develop expertise in fraud and credit risk prevention, has excellent communication and strong interpersonal skills, is able to document effectively.

This is a unique opportunity for analysts who are eager to immerse themselves in the heart of fintech business, develop additional muscles, and grow within a fast-paced and dynamic environment. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, apply creative problem-solving skills, and drive business growth through data-driven strategies.

Responsibilities


Perform analysis to develop a deep understanding of the product, and its usage, business processes, and to support business and research hypotheses, including A/B testing of product ideas, identifying new product and business opportunities
Support product segments in creating effective tracking and measurement plans to ensure the impact of new features align with our product strategy
Design data models as part of data solution to support reporting and analysis needs
Create, maintain and update dashboards and reports using BI tools to communicate insights effectively
Enhance data processes, identify gaps, and streamline data collection
Collect, consolidate, and closely track KPI metrics regarding Billie’s portfolio
Perform comprehensive data analysis and EDA to support Risk and Fraud systems optimization
Communicate and present recommendations and key insights to stakeholders and executives to drive business decisions and create an impact
Communicate issues in an independent and timely manner with appropriate internal and external partners


Who We Are Looking For


You have 5+ years of proven experience in data analytics, data engineering or quantitative analytics
Proficiency in writing structured and efficient SQL queries for large data sets
Proficiency in data and analytics concepts, tools, and methodologies
Have prior experience building intuitive data visualizations and dashboards that influence business decisions, utilizing tools like Looker, Tableau, Mixpanel, or similar
Proven track record of managing complex initiatives with strong emphasis on data, providing actionable insights and tracking success of those initiatives
Able to communicate complex problems in a simple and relevant manner at all levels
Experience with translating analytical insights into data driven business prioritization
You have strong business acumen coupled with highly analytical mindset
You had the chance to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
Strong sense of responsibility, self-starter, well organized, good planner, able to work independently and meet deadlines
Previously experience in a fraud, risk & payment management environment is an advantage


What We Offer


Challenging and impactful work that drives personal and professional growth
One of the best Virtual Shares Incentive Programs in the market, so that everyone at Billie is invested in our success
Flexible work hours and trust in your ability to deliver, empowering you to take control of your work-life balance
A hybrid working approach that allows you to work from home for up to 3 days per week
Enjoy 30 days vacation per year on top of paid public holidays, sabbatical opportunities, and extra child sickness leave for parents
Our “Catch a Ride with Billie” program that enables discounted access to Berlin Public Transport (BVG), Deutschland-Ticket, OR JobRad
A yearly development budget to broaden your skill set and horizons
Free German group classes
An English-speaking, multicultural team with more than 40 nationalities represented
Building meaningful connections with your colleagues through company and team events, interest groups, the Billie run club, game nights, and more, powered by our Formula Fun Team!
Great office space at Checkpoint Charlie with free gym access, barista coffee, drinks and more


Billie offers you the opportunity to be a part of one of the fastest-growing Fintech startups in Europe following the mission to innovate to create new freedom for businesses of all sizes. Our combined decades of experience in B2B Financing and Payments in a market thirsty for innovation and change make this a fantastic possibility to get into the most dynamic space in tech.

Join an international team of talented, passionate people where drive and merit matter. We work in nimble, cross-functional teams with open communication lines across the company. You’ll be surrounded by smart people from a wide variety of backgrounds from which you can learn and that want to learn from you.

Are you ready to join Billie?

Billie is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment in our workplace. By embracing talents and abilities of all kinds, we aim to boost motivation and team creativity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, age, marital status, gender, political views, beliefs, sexual orientation, color, disability status, or any other demographic factors.
Show more
HTML:
We are Billie, the leading provider of Buy Now, Pay Later (BNPL) payment methods for businesses, offering B2B companies innovative digital payment services and modern checkout solutions. We are to create a new standard for business payments and have made it our mission to simplify the purchasing experience for all businesses making it a tool for growth. Our solutions are based on proprietary, machine-learning-supported risk models, fully digitized processes and a highly scalable tech platform. This makes us a deep-tech company building financial products, not the other way around. We love building simple and elegant solutions and we strive for automation and scalability.

About The Role

Billie’s Analytics team is at the heart of the company supporting multiple functions to make data-driven decisions. Analytics team works closely with all Product segments, and other departments by innovating, hypothesizing, strategizing and providing recommended actions to relevant stakeholders (Decision science, Business Development and Account Management, Collection and Underwriting teams, Customer support and Marketing) in an integrated, scalable, secure and compliant way to enable the company's sustainable growth.

In this role, you will have the chance to make a significant impact by leveraging data and analytics tools, will look for solutions, establish relationships to be able to guide business decisions within the company values and expectations, and contribute to the ongoing growth of our portfolio.

The role is for someone who is a self-starter, enjoys exploring data for insights to support strategic decision making, is passionate about building data structures, analyzing and reporting on key performance indicators, comfortable to work on operational matters, willing to develop expertise in fraud and credit risk prevention, has excellent communication and strong interpersonal skills, is able to document effectively.

This is a unique opportunity for analysts who are eager to immerse themselves in the heart of fintech business, develop additional muscles, and grow within a fast-paced and dynamic environment. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, apply creative problem-solving skills, and drive business growth through data-driven strategies.

Responsibilities

  • Perform analysis to develop a deep understanding of the product, and its usage, business processes, and to support business and research hypotheses, including A/B testing of product ideas, identifying new product and business opportunities
  • Support product segments in creating effective tracking and measurement plans to ensure the impact of new features align with our product strategy
  • Design data models as part of data solution to support reporting and analysis needs
  • Create, maintain and update dashboards and reports using BI tools to communicate insights effectively
  • Enhance data processes, identify gaps, and streamline data collection
  • Collect, consolidate, and closely track KPI metrics regarding Billie’s portfolio
  • Perform comprehensive data analysis and EDA to support Risk and Fraud systems optimization
  • Communicate and present recommendations and key insights to stakeholders and executives to drive business decisions and create an impact
  • Communicate issues in an independent and timely manner with appropriate internal and external partners

Who We Are Looking For

  • You have 5+ years of proven experience in data analytics, data engineering or quantitative analytics
  • Proficiency in writing structured and efficient SQL queries for large data sets
  • Proficiency in data and analytics concepts, tools, and methodologies
  • Have prior experience building intuitive data visualizations and dashboards that influence business decisions, utilizing tools like Looker, Tableau, Mixpanel, or similar
  • Proven track record of managing complex initiatives with strong emphasis on data, providing actionable insights and tracking success of those initiatives
  • Able to communicate complex problems in a simple and relevant manner at all levels
  • Experience with translating analytical insights into data driven business prioritization
  • You have strong business acumen coupled with highly analytical mindset
  • You had the chance to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
  • Strong sense of responsibility, self-starter, well organized, good planner, able to work independently and meet deadlines
  • Previously experience in a fraud, risk & payment management environment is an advantage

What We Offer

  • Challenging and impactful work that drives personal and professional growth
  • One of the best Virtual Shares Incentive Programs in the market, so that everyone at Billie is invested in our success
  • Flexible work hours and trust in your ability to deliver, empowering you to take control of your work-life balance
  • A hybrid working approach that allows you to work from home for up to 3 days per week
  • Enjoy 30 days vacation per year on top of paid public holidays, sabbatical opportunities, and extra child sickness leave for parents
  • Our “Catch a Ride with Billie” program that enables discounted access to Berlin Public Transport (BVG), Deutschland-Ticket, OR JobRad
  • A yearly development budget to broaden your skill set and horizons
  • Free German group classes
  • An English-speaking, multicultural team with more than 40 nationalities represented
  • Building meaningful connections with your colleagues through company and team events, interest groups, the Billie run club, game nights, and more, powered by our Formula Fun Team!
  • Great office space at Checkpoint Charlie with free gym access, barista coffee, drinks and more

Billie offers you the opportunity to be a part of one of the fastest-growing Fintech startups in Europe following the mission to innovate to create new freedom for businesses of all sizes. Our combined decades of experience in B2B Financing and Payments in a market thirsty for innovation and change make this a fantastic possibility to get into the most dynamic space in tech.

Join an international team of talented, passionate people where drive and merit matter. We work in nimble, cross-functional teams with open communication lines across the company. You’ll be surrounded by smart people from a wide variety of backgrounds from which you can learn and that want to learn from you.

Are you ready to join Billie?

Billie is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment in our workplace. By embracing talents and abilities of all kinds, we aim to boost motivation and team creativity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, age, marital status, gender, political views, beliefs, sexual orientation, color, disability status, or any other demographic factors.

Title: (Junior) Data Consultant (m/w/d)
Description:
Die Position

Wir suchen eine/n (Junior) Data Consultant (m/w/d) zur Verstärkung unseres Data Teams bei Project A.

In deiner täglichen Arbeit fokussierst Du dich auf die Identifizierung von Daten, die zu Wachstum und Effizienz bei unseren Kunden beitragen können. In Zusammenarbeit mit unserem Data Engineering- und Science Team hilfst Du dabei, diese Möglichkeiten zu nutzen. Dabei konzentrierst du dich auf die tatsächliche Wirkung und nicht auf den Einsatz neuer Technologien oder Methoden und erhältst gleichzeitig einzigartige Einblicke in das Arbeitsumfeld eines der führenden Venture Capital in Europa.

Unser Data Team ist der festen Überzeugung, dass das Jahrzehnt der Daten begonnen hat: Durch die Arbeit mit über 70 Kunden haben wir gelernt, wie man Rohdaten in echte Erkenntnisse, Produkte, Funktionen und mehr verwandelt.

Jetzt liegt es an dir, diese Daten zu nutzen, um durch aufschlussreiche Visualisierungen, bemerkenswerte Analysen und aussagekräftige Stakeholder-Beziehungen ein tatsächliches Geschäftswachstum zu erzielen.

Motivation, Kreativität und Offenheit prägen unsere Werte und Kultur. Deshalb ermutigen wir dich, sich eigenständig in deine Arbeit einzubringen. Werde Teil eines multinationalen Teams von klugen Köpfen und lass dich inspirieren, zu wachsen, innovativ zu sein und von Anfang an Verantwortung zu übernehmen.

Sei verantwortlich für:


Beratung unserer Kunden, Daten sinnvoll zu nutzen und datengesteuerte Entscheidungen zu fördern
Proaktives Erkennen und Umsetzen relevanter Datenprojekte für unsere Kunden - hinsichtlich ihrer strategischen- und Investitionsziele
Projekte mit Teammitgliedern vorantreiben und in Unternehmen reales Wachstum fördern
Aufbau von nachhaltigen Beziehungen zu Stakeholdern aus diversen Unternehmen und Industrien
Enge Zusammenarbeit mit dem Data Engineering & Science-Team bei dem Management von Data Warehousing und Machine Learning Projekten
Daten Tracking und Erfassung mit verschiedenen client- und server gestützten Lösungen



Dein Profil


1-2 Jahre Berufserfahrung im Bereich Data Consulting - idealerweise in einem leistungsstarken und dynamischen Umfeld, wobei ein Hintergrund in der Beratung oder in einer Agentur von Vorteil ist
Hohes Maß an emotionaler Intelligenz, um nachhaltige Beziehungen zu (leitenden) Interessengruppen aufzubauen und zu pflegen
Erste Erfahrung in mindestens einem speziellen Datenbereich (z.B. Marketing Analytics, Product Analytics, Data Governance, Customer Analytics) ist von Vorteil
Bereits Umgang mit Tools zur Datenanalyse und -modellierung, inkl. SQL / dbt
Erste Kenntnisse im Bereich MDS: Datenerfassung (Google Tag Manager, Segment), Datenintegration (Fivetran, Airbyte), Datenbanken (Snowflake, BigQuery), Datenmodellierung (dbt, DataForm) & Aktivierung (Looker, Metabase, PowerBI, Census)
Fließend in Deutsch und Englisch ist ein Muss



Bitte beachte, dass wir Unterstützung in unserem Berliner Büro suchen. Die Berechtigung, innerhalb der EU zu arbeiten, ist ebenfalls erforderlich.

Wie wir in deinen Erfolg investieren:


Gestalte die Zukunft: Übernimm die Leitung bei spannenden Projekten, egal ob aufstrebendes oder führendes Unternehmen in Europa und Großbritannien.
Arbeite Seite an Seite mit Experten: Profitiere von einem Team aus hoch motivierten Kollegen, die diverse Erfahrung aus internationalen Backgrounds mitbringen und Ihr Wissen mit dir teilen. Für deinen maximalen Lerneffekt.
Gib deiner Karriere einen Boost: Mit abwechslungsreichen Projekten und maßgeschneiderten Trainings statten wir dich mit allem aus, was du für deinen nächsten Karriereschritt brauchst.
Strebe nach Fortschritt: Hast du eine spannende Idee oder ein neues Tool im Blick? Lass es uns ausprobieren! Mit unserem großzügigen F&E-Budget hast du die Freiheit, neue Technologien auszuprobieren und unsere Prozesse zu verbessern.
Wachse durch Zusammenarbeit: Knüpfe wertvolle Kontakte bei regelmäßigen Events und tausche dich in dynamischen Netzwerken aus – für dein persönliches und unser gemeinsames Wachstum.
Übernimm Verantwortung Strebe nach Fortschritt: Wir stellen dir die Tools und Strukturen zur Verfügung, die du benötigst. Dafür ermutigen wir dich, deine Kreativität einzusetzen und schätzen dabei Autonomie bei der Umsetzung deiner Projekte.



Wir engagieren uns für Diversität und Inklusion

Project A bekennt sich zu Diversität und Chancengleichheit, dies gilt gleichermaßen für unsere Mitarbeitenden als auch Kandidat:Innen.

Wir schätzen die Menschen – mit all ihren herrlichen, vielfältigen Hintergründen, Perspektiven und Erfahrungen. Unser vielfältiges Team hat unterschiedliche ethnische und kulturelle Hintergründe, geschlechtliche Identitäten, sexuelle Orientierungen, Familienverhältnisse, religiöse und politische Zugehörigkeiten, sozioökonomische Status, Altersgruppen und Fähigkeiten. Mit 32 Nationalitäten und über 25 gesprochenen Sprachen sind wir sicher, dass du dich bei uns wie zu Hause fühlen wirst. Wir freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung.
Show more

Title: Marketing Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Als Marketing BI Analyst (m/w/d) im Global Digital Marketing & Sales Operations Team bist du maßgeblich dafür verantwortlich, datengetriebene Insights für unsere Marketing-, Service- und Vertriebsaktivitäten zu generieren und aufzubereiten. Durch die Aggregation, Analyse und Visualisierung von Daten aus verschiedenen Quellen trägst du entscheidend zur Optimierung unserer Customer Journey, der Effizienz unserer Marketing- und Lead-Generierungskampagnen, der Call Center Management Prozesse und der strategischen Entscheidungsfindung bei.

Was du bewirkst


Durchführung von Analysen der Customer Journey anhand der Global Digital Marketing Daten, um Trends zu identifizieren und Handlungsempfehlungen abzuleiten
Entwicklung, Pflege und Optimierung von Dashboards und Reportings in Power BI und Google Sheets zur Visualisierung und Überwachung von KPIs
Automatisierung und Optimierung von Datenprozessen und Sicherstellung der Datenqualität durch den Einsatz von Python, SQL und Databricks
Unterstützung des zentralen sowie globalen Marketings bei der Planung, dem Forecasting und dem unterjährigen Monitoring ihrer Ziel-KPIs
Erstellung länderspezifischer Analysen, um Wachstum zu generieren und die Nutzung der digitalen Marketingkanäle in den einzelnen Märkten zu optimieren
Enge Zusammenarbeit mit den Data Engineering und Data Science Teams innerhalb der Viessmann IT
Aufbereitung von Ergebnissen in Form von Präsentationen, Reports und Zusammenfassungen für relevante Stakeholder


Das bist du


Abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich Wirtschaftswissenschaften, BWL, Data Science oder einem vergleichbaren analytischen Bereich
Mehrjährige Berufserfahrung in den Bereichen Business Intelligence, Data Analytics, CRM oder in einem vergleichbaren analytischen Bereich
Sehr gute analytische Fähigkeiten sowie Kenntnisse in Statistik und Data Modeling
Fundierte Erfahrung mit Tools wie Power BI, Google Data Studio, Databricks und idealerweise auch mit Python, SQL oder ähnlichen Technologien
Erfahrung bei der Analyse von CRM, Call Center und/oder Performance Marketing Daten
Fähigkeit, komplexe Daten verständlich und wirkungsvoll aufzubereiten und zu präsentieren
Selbstständige, strukturierte Arbeitsweise und Freude an der Arbeit in einem internationalen, cross-funktionalen Team
Sprachkenntnisse in Deutsch und Englisch (mind. Level B2)


Auch wenn du nicht alle Punkte erfüllst, aber bereit für die Herausforderung bist, dann klicke trotzdem auf "Bewerben". Wir lieben deinen Spirit!

Das macht uns besonders

Unsere Mitarbeiter:innen sind der Schlüssel dazu, unsere Vision zum Leben zu erwecken. Basierend auf dieser Überzeugung haben wir Benefits für unsere Mitarbeiter:innen geschaffen:


Dich erwartet eine Festanstellung in einem erfolgreichen Unternehmen, in dem neue Technologien auf eine moderne Arbeitsplatzkultur treffen.
Bei Viessmann Climate Solutions bekommst du 30 Tage bezahlten Urlaub im Jahr.
Du hast als Mitarbeiter:in erfolgreich eine neue Kollegin oder einen Kollegen geworben? Als Dankeschön bekommst du eine Empfehlungsprämie.
Genieße unsere großartigen Exklusiv-Rabatte auf ausgewählte Viessmann Climate Solutions Produkte und Dienstleistungen.
Kleiner Energiekick zwischendurch gefällig? Bei uns stehen kostenlose gesunde Snacks und Getränke für dich bereit.
Für ein gesundes Miteinander: Unser Gesundheitsprogramm bietet einfachen Zugang zu Coachings und Therapie für unsere Mitarbeitenden und deren Familien.
Ob mit Job Bike oder mit Europcar – unsere Partnerschaften schonen gleichzeitig die Umwelt und deinen Geldbeutel.
Unsere Viessmann Akademie und externen Partner bieten zahlreiche fachliche und persönliche Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten an.
Viessmann bietet dir, wann immer möglich, die Option zum mobilen Arbeiten und sorgt für die passende technische Ausstattung.
Bei uns kommt der Spaß nicht zu kurz, denn bei Viessmann freuen wir uns auf gemeinsame Events, wie unser monatliches Frühstück oder andere Teamevents.
Unsere flexiblen Arbeitszeiten ermöglichen es dir, Arbeit und Privatleben miteinander zu vereinbaren.
Kita oder Schule zu? Kein Problem! In unserem Eltern-Kind-Raum hat dein Nachwuchs ausreichend Platz und Spielzeuge und du hast einen voll ausgestatteten Arbeitsplatz.


Das sind wir

Wir sind Viessmann Climate Solutions. 1917 als Heiztechnik-Hersteller gegründet, sind wir heute, als Teil von Carrier, ein weltweit führender Anbieter für effiziente und systemische Klima- und erneuerbare Energielösungen für den Wohn- und Gewerbesektor. Wir decken alle Anwendungen ab: Heizen, Kühlen, Lüften, Wasser- und Luftqualität, Energieerzeugung und Energiespeicherung für den Wohn- und Gebäudesektor.

Unser integriertes Lösungsangebot verbindet Produkte und Systeme über digitale Plattformen und Dienstleistungen nahtlos zu einer ganzheitlichen Klima- und Energielösung und schafft so ein sicheres und verlässliches Wohlfühlklima für unsere Nutzer:innen. Alle Aktivitäten basieren auf unserem Unternehmensleitbild „Wir gestalten Lebensräume für zukünftige Generationen‟ und unsere Mitarbeiter:innen spielen dabei mit Leidenschaft eine aktive Rolle bei der Energiewende. Sei ein Teil von dieser spannenden Reise.
Show more

Wir sind Viessmann Climate Solutions. 1917 als Heiztechnik-Hersteller gegründet, sind wir heute, als Teil von Carrier, ein weltweit führender Anbieter für effiziente und systemische Klima- und erneuerbare Energielösungen für den Wohn- und Gewerbesektor. Wir decken alle Anwendungen ab: Heizen, Kühlen, Lüften, Wasser- und Luftqualität, Energieerzeugung und Energiespeicherung für den Wohn- und Gebäudesektor.

Unser integriertes Lösungsangebot verbindet Produkte und Systeme über digitale Plattformen und Dienstleistungen nahtlos zu einer ganzheitlichen Klima- und Energielösung und schafft so ein sicheres und verlässliches Wohlfühlklima für unsere Nutzer:innen. Alle Aktivitäten basieren auf unserem Unternehmensleitbild „Wir gestalten Lebensräume für zukünftige Generationen‟ und unsere Mitarbeiter:innen spielen dabei mit Leidenschaft eine aktive Rolle bei der Energiewende. Sei ein Teil von dieser spannenden Reise.

Title: Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Berlin - Berlin - Germany, Frankfurt am Main - Hessen - Germany, Hamburg - Hamburg - Germany

GEMEINSAM ERFOLGREICH


Sie suchen eine neue Herausforderung? Sie möchten Ihre Karriere in eine neue Richtung lenken? Sie möchten etwas bewegen?

UnserData Intelligence & Digital Enablement Teamin Deutschland schafft durch den Einsatz von Daten, Technologien und innovativen Lösungen echten Mehrwert für unser Business. Wir treiben die digitale Transformation des Unternehmens voran, managen zentrale Enterprise Applikationen und unterstützen unsere operativen Business- und Research-Teams bei der Erweiterung, Pflege, Konsolidierung, Analyse und Visualisierung einer einzigartigen Immobiliendatenlandschaft.

Für unser Team suchen wir ab sofort einenData Analyst (m/w/d)inBerlin, HamburgoderFrankfurt am Main.


AlsData Analyst (m/w/d)steuern Sie zentrale Datenprojekte für CBRE-Standorte in Deutschland, entwickeln unsere cloud-basierte Datenplattform weiter und automatisieren Prozesse, um datengetriebene Entscheidungen zu ermöglichen.

IMMOBILIEN – WIR MACHEN DAS


CBRE ist – in Bezug auf den Umsatz im Geschäftsjahr 2023 – der größte globale Immobiliendienstleister. Mit mehr als 130.000 Mitarbeitern in über 100 Ländern steht CBRE Investoren und Immobiliennutzern als Partner für alle Immobilienbelange weltweit zur Seite. Wir bieten unseren Kunden ein breites Spektrum an integrierten Leistungen aus einer Hand – über den gesamten Lebenszyklus einer Immobilie hinweg.

DAS MACHEN SIE BEI UNS



(Weiter-)Entwicklung und Verwaltung zentraler Business Intelligence (BI) Produkte für den Geschäftsbereich Property Management (PM) in enger Abstimmung mit den relevanten internen Stakeholdern
Bearbeitung von hoch priorisierten neuen Anwendungsfällen aus dem Anforderungskatalog der PM-Plattform mithilfe von Datenbankabfragen und BI Tools in enger Abstimmung mit dem Data Engineering Team
Überprüfung und gegebenenfalls Neuentwicklung existierender PM-Datenmanagement-Prozesse
Dokumentation bestehender und zukünftiger datenbezogener Anwendungsfälle von PM
Erstellung eines Datenkatalogs inklusive Data Lineage und Business Glossary
Enge Zusammenarbeit mit den Continental Europe Data Teams zur Anpassung regionaler Tools an den lokalen Kontext
Eigenständige, proaktive Weiterbildung und Recherche in PM-relevanten Themen mithilfe von internen und externen Ressourcen


DAS HABEN SIE ZU BIETEN



Master-Abschluss (Universität/FH) in Wirtschaftsinformatik, Geoinformatik, Wirtschaftsmathematik, quantitativ-orientierter Geographie oder vergleichbaren Studiengängen
Fachkenntnisse und/oder Praxiserfahrung in der Immobilienwirtschaft, idealerweise mit Fokus Property Management
Idealerweise 1-2 Jahre relevante Berufserfahrung in fortgeschrittener Datenanalyse auf Datenbankebene (PostgreSQL & Snowflake), Datenqualitätsmanagement, Datenvisualisierung und Projektmanagement
Sehr gute Kenntnisse in der Datenbanksprache SQL sowie im Umgang mit BI-Tools (z.B. Tableau, Alteryx) sind zwingend erforderlich
Grundkenntnisse in Programmiersprachen wie Python oder R sind von Vorteil
Sehr gute Kenntnisse in MS Office365 (Excel, Powerpoint, Teams, Planner, OneNote)
Kenntnisse in Datenvisualisierung und Graphikdesign sind von Vorteil
Hervorragende schriftliche und verbale Kommunikationsfähigkeit auf Deutsch und Englisch; sehr gute organisatorische und analytische Fähigkeiten; sorgfältige, proaktive und verlässliche Arbeitsweise; gute Präsentationsfähigkeit
Kundenorientierte, enthusiastische, hands-on, problemlösungs- und innovationsorientierte Grundeinstellung


DAS BIETEN WIR IHNEN



Wir machen flexibles und mobiles Arbeiten möglich: Egal ob im Büro, zu Hause, unterwegs oder während einer Workation
Werden Sie Teil des einzigartigen CBRE-Spirits und profitieren Sie von schnellen Entscheidungswegen und Duz-Kultur
Bleiben Sie mobil mit unserem Fahrtkostenzuschuss zum ÖPNV
Durch das offene high-end Bürokonzept leben wir täglich unsere Unternehmenskultur auf Augenhöhe
Erfolge zusammen feiern! Dafür gibt es Gelegenheit bei regelmäßigen Team-Events
Profitieren Sie von weiteren Benefits wie Familienservice, Corporate Benefits, Betriebliche Altersvorsorge, Sonderkonditionen für Fitnessstudios, JobRad u.v.m


MACHEN SIE MIT?


Werden Sie Teil unserer Erfolgsgeschichte! - Wir freuen uns über Ihre Bewerbung als Data Analyst (m/w/d) über unser Online-Bewerbungssystem, inklusive Lebenslauf, Anschreiben und relevanten Zeugnissen.

Bitte beachten Sie, dass wir aus Datenschutzgründen leider keine Bewerbungen per E-Mail annehmen können.

Bei Rückfragen zur Stellenanzeige wenden Sie sich gerne per E-Mail an unser Talent Acquisition Team: bewerbung@cbre.com

Service line: None

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Marketing (d/f/m)
Description:
Personio's intelligent HR platform helps small and medium-sized organizations unlock the power of people by making complicated, time-consuming tasks simple and efficient. Our growing team of 1,800+ Personios across Europe and the US are building user-friendly products that delight our 14,000+ customers and their 1.5 million employees. Ready to make an impact from day one?

The Role: How you'll make an impact at Personio

This position can be hybrid from one of the following office locations: London, Munich, Dublin, or Berlin.

We empower Personio's decision-making with advanced analytics and strategic insights, while boosting productivity through systems improvement and automation. Be part of our transformative journey in HR technology, where your contributions will shape our data-driven future.

In this pivotal role, you'll spearhead our marketing strategies, aligning them seamlessly with sales objectives to propel business success. As a Senior Marketing Data Analyst, you'll be the cornerstone of our Go-to-market department, leveraging your expertise in analysis, trend forecasting, and strategic planning to ignite innovative marketing initiatives and foster robust collaboration with our Sales team.

Role Responsibilities: What you'll do


Strategic Marketing Planning: You'll lead data-driven strategies within our Go-to-market framework, ensuring they resonate with our sales targets and organizational objectives.
Marketing Campaign Analysis: You're responsible for assessing campaign performance, optimizing for maximum ROI across various channels and regions.
Customer Segmentation and Personalization: You will execute advanced segmentation and collaborate with the GTM team for targeted marketing, boosting lead conversion and retention.
Trend Identification and Forecasting: Your role involves analyzing market trends, predicting future shifts, and offering competitive insights.
Team Leadership and Collaboration: You will mentor analysts and ensure cross-departmental cohesion, particularly with Sales and CX teams.
Report Generation and Presentation: You're tasked with creating and presenting reports that drive continuous improvement.
Budget Management: You oversee marketing KPI adjustments within our bi-annual budget review, ensuring alignment with financial and marketing goals.


Role Requirements: What you need to succeed


Experience: 5+ years in marketing analytics, with a leadership background.
Statistical Knowledge: Understanding of basic statistical models for business problem analysis.
Platform Familiarity: Skilled in Google Analytics, HubSpot, Salesforce, Marketo, Dreamdata, and Snowflake.
Data-Driven Leadership: Experience in fostering a data-centric culture and making data-based decisions.
Analytical Mindset: Intellectual curiosity to delve into data, identifying trends, patterns, and actionable insights.
Communication Skills: Ability to simplify complex data insights for diverse stakeholders.
Entrepreneurial Approach: Proactive problem-solving, focusing on impactful results and leveraging data insights for tangible improvements.


Why Personio

Personio is an equal opportunities employer, committed to building an integrative culture where everyone feels welcomed and supported. We embrace uniqueness and understand that our diverse, values-driven culture makes us stronger. We are proud to have an inclusive workplace environment that will foster your development no matter your gender, civil status, family status, sexual orientation, religion, age, disability, education level, or race.

Aside from our people, culture, and mission, check out some of the other benefits that make Personio a great place to work:


Receive a competitive reward package – reevaluated each year – that includes salary, benefits, and pre-IPO equity
Enjoy 28 days of paid vacation, plus an additional day after 2 and 4 years
Make an impact on the environment and society with 1 Impact Day per year
Receive generous family leave, child support, mental health support, and sabbatical opportunities
We follow an office-led, remote-friendly approach, including opportunities to work from home and international locations. Many of our teams have designated days for gathering in the office to enhance collaboration and foster a sense of community.
We enjoy gathering for meals, cultural initiatives, and events like local Summer Sessions and year-end celebrations. There's also healthy snacks, drinks, and a weekly catered lunch.
Show more
