Title: International Trainee - Data Analytics
Description:
Über die Stelle

Shape the path towards fossil freedom.   

Are you ready to challenge the status quo, lead us down new paths and contribute to solving one of humankind's greatest challenges – climate change? We are searching for talented individuals to join us as International Trainees at Vattenfall. Help us lead the energy transition and make a real impact.

About The Traineeship.   

This traineeship offers you a unique opportunity to kickstart your career in our sustainable business. Each of the trainee positions is distinct, tied to a department within a specific business area and working location. This means that each position has its own tailored responsibilities, challenges and matching profile.   

What you will experience:


Personal development: Benefit from a year full of growth opportunities, professional meetups, and comprehensive training.   
International exposure: Engage with a diverse, international trainee team both virtually and in person. Participate in job rotations and on-site visits.  
Collaborative environment: Enjoy a balance of serious work and a fun, supportive atmosphere.  


As Joakim, our International Trainee in Stockholm, states, “I expected beforehand that working at a corporate would mean only serious business. We do focus on learning and growth and bringing new perspectives to the company, but we also have fun and add humor and lightness. I feel like we are the change the company wants to see.”  

Your role as a Trainee - Data Analytics

We are a virtual international team of data engineers and scientists who work on various data projects supporting one of the Vattenfall’s fastest growing business units – Distribution Sweden (Eldistribution). By joining us as a Trainee in Data Analytics, you would become a part of one of the DevOps teams which develops and maintains data solutions based on Microsoft Azure technology stack. Moreover, you would be in direct contact with experts from other IT departments to build, maintain and optimize state of the art analytics solutions; and with business stakeholders to deliver data-driven solutions and insights that support the business goals and objectives.

Ihr Profil

Your Qualifications As a Trainee - Data Analytics

To succeed in this position, we are looking for individuals who possess both the professional and personal skills to thrive in a dynamic, global environment.

Below are the key qualifications we seek:  


University degree in computer science, industrial engineering, data engineering or other relevant field.
Experience with the Microsoft Azure stack, any experience with Databricks is a plus.
Experience with data processing, machine learning, AI.
Proven skills in PowerBI are a plus.


You should also recognize yourself in:


You have a proactive attitude in delivering the most effective solutions and an innovative mindset.
You have an interest in new technology and a curiosity to learn every day.
You are an effective communicator and a team player with the ability to build relationships with various stakeholders.
You have an interest in project management and can adapt quickly to new and challenging situations.


 To be considered for our traineeship, we are looking for candidates who should:   


Be a recent graduate with an academic degree or expected graduation before September 2025.  
Maximum one year of work experience after completing your most recent degree, with time spent at internships and student jobs not counting towards the experience limit.
Excellent command of English, both verbally and written. Language skills in Swedish are a plus.
Be willing to travel regularly and relocate for short rotations within our organization.   
Identify with our values: active, open, positive and safety.   
Have a strong desire for long-term commitment to contribute to Vattenfall’s vision, making a lasting impact on the future of energy.


Location

You will be working in the department Asset Analytics & IoT. Possible location options for this position are Stockholm, Berlin, Katowice, Hamburg and Amsterdam.

Our International Trainee Aliaksandra, based in Hamburg, mentions: “Being part of the Trainee Programme at Vattenfall gives me a unique perspective on our pivotal role at the forefront of the energy transition. The programme has empowered me to grow, take on challenges and collaborate with talented people across an international organization.”

Zusätzliche Informationen

Our offer  

The Vattenfall International Trainee Programme is the kickstart of your career within Vattenfall. Over the course of a year, you will develop your professional and personal skills, participate in international workshops and site visits, and have the opportunity to work abroad. Each position comes with a competitive salary and excellent remuneration package. Read more about the elements of the Vattenfall International Trainee Programme here.    

As Rogier, our International Trainee in Amsterdam, shares: “Vattenfall provides me with the steepest learning curve. We are a group that feels connected by our core values in line with the organization's values. We all feel part of a movement that understands the importance of human connection, resilience, and curiosity in energy transition and sustainability.”

Our organisation   

At Vattenfall you can free your superpowers! We are one of the European market leaders in the generation of renewable energy and are primarily active in Scandinavia, Germany, Denmark, UK and the Netherlands. We are committed to a future where everyone can choose fossil-free ways to move, make, and live. We value diversity and inclusion in everything we do, read more about D&I within Vattenfall.   

Application process   

We welcome your application in English via the application button on this page. Please include an updated resume. When applying, you will fill out screening questions, including your motivation. No cover letter or motivation letter is needed. The deadline to apply is February, 9th, 2025. Selection will start after the application period with online tests, followed by interviews between the end of February to early April. We kindly ask you to use the same email address during the whole process (application and online test) otherwise there is a risk that your application is excluded due to system reasons. The final recruitment process will be completed by April/May, with a pre-employment screening. The Vattenfall International Trainee Programme starts on September 1st, 2025.   

Visit our FAQ site page for answers to common questions. If your question is not answered there, please contact the responsible recruiter Catalina Roa Rodriguez, catalina.roarodriguez@vattenfall.com.

The security of Vattenfall and its employees is essential. For that reason, a pre-employment screening may be part of your recruitment process. The screening will be performed by a third party, called Validata.   

Since Vattenfall is a part of the Swedish critical infrastructure, many of our services are security classed. If this position is security classed the final candidates might be subjected to a security vetting process, according to the Swedish legislation.  

In Sweden, the trade union representatives are Sofi Wadström (Akademikerna), Inger Strandberg (Unionen), Christer Gustafsson (Ledarna), Juha Siipilehto (SEKO). You can reach them on 08-739 50 00.

We look forward to your application!

Über das Unternehmen

Vattenfall is a leading European energy company driving the transition to a sustainable energy system. We have been electrifying industries, powering homes and transforming life through innovation for more than 100 years and now have a mission of working for fossil freedom. We employ around 21.000 people in Sweden, Germany, the Netherlands, Denmark, Finland, France and the UK.Vattenfall is a leading European energy company driving the transition to a sustainable energy system. We have been electrifying industries, powering homes and transforming life through innovation for more than 100 years and now have a mission of working for fossil freedom. We employ around 21 000 people in Sweden, Germany, the Netherlands, Denmark, Finland, France and the UK.

Our offer  

The Vattenfall International Trainee Programme is the kickstart of your career within Vattenfall. Over the course of a year, you will develop your professional and personal skills, participate in international workshops and site visits, and have the opportunity to work abroad. Each position comes with a competitive salary and excellent remuneration package. Read more about the elements of the Vattenfall International Trainee Programme here.    

As Rogier, our International Trainee in Amsterdam, shares: “Vattenfall provides me with the steepest learning curve. We are a group that feels connected by our core values in line with the organization's values. We all feel part of a movement that understands the importance of human connection, resilience, and curiosity in energy transition and sustainability.”

Our organisation   

At Vattenfall you can free your superpowers! We are one of the European market leaders in the generation of renewable energy and are primarily active in Scandinavia, Germany, Denmark, UK and the Netherlands. We are committed to a future where everyone can choose fossil-free ways to move, make, and live. We value diversity and inclusion in everything we do, read more about D&I within Vattenfall.   

Application process   

We welcome your application in English via the application button on this page. Please include an updated resume. When applying, you will fill out screening questions, including your motivation. No cover letter or motivation letter is needed. The deadline to apply is February, 9th, 2025. Selection will start after the application period with online tests, followed by interviews between the end of February to early April. We kindly ask you to use the same email address during the whole process (application and online test) otherwise there is a risk that your application is excluded due to system reasons. The final recruitment process will be completed by April/May, with a pre-employment screening. The Vattenfall International Trainee Programme starts on September 1st, 2025.   

Visit our FAQ site page for answers to common questions. If your question is not answered there, please contact the responsible recruiter Catalina Roa Rodriguez, catalina.roarodriguez@vattenfall.com.

The security of Vattenfall and its employees is essential. For that reason, a pre-employment screening may be part of your recruitment process. The screening will be performed by a third party, called Validata.   

Since Vattenfall is a part of the Swedish critical infrastructure, many of our services are security classed. If this position is security classed the final candidates might be subjected to a security vetting process, according to the Swedish legislation.  

In Sweden, the trade union representatives are Sofi Wadström (Akademikerna), Inger Strandberg (Unionen), Christer Gustafsson (Ledarna), Juha Siipilehto (SEKO). You can reach them on 08-739 50 00.

We look forward to your application!

Über das Unternehmen

Vattenfall is a leading European energy company driving the transition to a sustainable energy system. We have been electrifying industries, powering homes and transforming life through innovation for more than 100 years and now have a mission of working for fossil freedom. We employ around 21.000 people in Sweden, Germany, the Netherlands, Denmark, Finland, France and the UK.Vattenfall is a leading European energy company driving the transition to a sustainable energy system. We have been electrifying industries, powering homes and transforming life through innovation for more than 100 years and now have a mission of working for fossil freedom. We employ around 21 000 people in Sweden, Germany, the Netherlands, Denmark, Finland, France and the UK.

Title: Data Analyst e-health (m/w/d)
Description:
Gestalte mit uns die Zukunft von e-Health als Data Analyst (m/w/d)

Wir von docmetric suchen ausgezeichnete Data Analysts, die von unserer Mission "Niemand soll leiden oder gar sterben, nur weil einmal irgendwann, irgendwo wichtige medizinische Informationen fehlen.", getrieben sind. Es ist Deine Leidenschaft mittels neuester Tech-Stacks und Tools das Gesundheitswesen zu digitalisieren? Du hast Spaß an der Arbeit in einem interdisziplinären Team mit ausgeprägter Start-Up-Mentalität? Dann freuen wir uns auf Deine Bewerbung!

Dein Beitrag


Als Data-Analyst bist Du für die Bewertung von Datenquellen und die programmatische Aufbereitung, Anreicherung und Normalisierung von Daten in Python zuständig
Dabei verantwortest du die kontinuierliche Optimierung der Datenqualität
Du unterstützt uns beim Aufbau und der Weiterentwicklung interner Datenbanken und Datenstrukturen
Du analysierst strukturierte und unstrukturierte Daten aus einer Vielzahl von Quellen des Gesundheitswesens
Durch die Erstellung und Pflege von Reports und Dashboards übersetzt du Anforderungen interner und externer Stakeholder in die Welt der Daten


Das Bringst Du Mit


Berufserfahrung im Bereich Data Analytics, idealerweise in der Arbeit mit Gesundheitsdaten
Abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich der (Medizin-) Informatik, Mathematik, Naturwissenschaften oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation
Erfahrung mit Python, Pandas, SQL sind ein Muss; Erfahrung mit Elasticsearch (oder vergleichbaren NoSQL Datenbanken) und PowerBI sind von Vorteil
Gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift (mind. B1)
Ein agiles Mindset und eine Leidenschaft für die Analyse von Daten


Das Kannst Du Von Uns Erwarten


Sinn und Zweck: Werde Teil einer wichtigen Mission - An der Schnittstelle von Gesundheitswesen und Digitalisierung gestalten wir die Zukunft von e-Health.
Attraktive Standorte mit echten Communities: Bei uns stehen die Menschen und der Zusammenhalt im Mittelpunkt. Hierfür bieten wir Dir attraktive Standorte.
Flache Hierarchien: Best of Both Worlds - Wir sind ein Konzern mit stabilen Strukturen und absoluter Expertise, aber bieten Dir gleichzeitig ein agiles Umfeld mit flachen Hierarchien.
Gestaltungsspielraum: Du kannst in spannenden Projekten viel bewegen. Wir bieten Dir vielfältige Weiterentwicklungsmöglichkeiten und langfristige Perspektiven
Rundum-Paket: Mitarbeiterrabatte, ein ausgereiftes Feel-Good-Management sowie weitere standortspezifische Angebote.


Überzeugt? Bewirb Dich jetzt online mit Deinen aussagekräftigen Bewerbungsunterlagen (inkl. Gehaltsvorstellung und nächstmöglichen Eintrittstermin).

We create the future of e-Health.

Werde Teil einer bedeutenden Mission.
Show more

Title: Business / Data Analyst*in (w/m/div)
Description:
Du arbeitest gerne authentisch auf Augenhöhe von Mensch zu Mensch?
Dann komm zu uns!
Wir, die Sparda-Bank Berlin mit ca. 800 Kolleg*innen, sind als Genossenschaftsbank im und für den Osten von Deutschland tätig.
Für unsere 470.000 Privatkund*innen arbeiten wir alle täglich daran, positive Kundenerlebnisse zu erschaffen. Unser Handeln und unsere Kontaktpunkte richten sich dabei stets an den Bedürfnissen unserer Kund*innen aus. Banking für, mit und von Menschen!



Komm und bereichere unseren Bereich MarktService in der Abteilung Qualitätsmanagement als



Business / Data Analyst*in (w/m/div)
80 % remote möglich



Hier darfst du dich austoben:



Herausfinden, was Kund*innen wollen, dank Daten und Analysen, ganz ohne Kristallkugel – das ist dein Job bei uns.
Zukunftsfähige und auf unsere Kund*innen bestens abgestimmte Services – dafür analysierst und optimierst du unsere Geschäftsprozesse, nimmst Kundendaten genau unter die Lupe und unterstützt uns aktiv, unsere Kund*innen glücklich zu machen.
Dabei bringst du Daten und Wirtschaft­lich­keits­analysen zusammen, deckst versteckte Potenziale auf und machst Prozesse und Datenqualität immer noch ein bisschen besser.
Klar, dass hier auch der Blick über den Tellerrand mit dazu gehört: Was macht der Markt? Wo liegen Trends? Wie können wir neue Ideen daraus entwickeln? Du recherchierst umsichtig, evaluierst gründlich, was zu uns passt, und bringst innovative Lösungen an den Start.
Damit wir Entscheidungen fundiert und zielführend treffen können, entwickelst du smarte Kennzahlensysteme, die genau die Insights liefern, die wir für unsere strategische Weiterentwicklung brauchen.
Und damit das Ganze nicht bloß hintergründige Daten-Theorie bleibt, baust du mit klaren Dashboards und ansprechenden Präsentationen Brücken zur praktischen Anwendung, die bei Stakeholdern und Teams wirklich Eindruck machen und echte Mehrwerte liefern.



Hier zählt dein Können:



Du bringst ein erfolgreich absolviertes Studium der Wirtschaftswissenschaften, (Wirtschafts-)Informatik oder einer MINT-Fachrichtung mit oder hast eine vergleichbare Qualifikation.
Du passt zu uns und unseren Werten.
Zusätzlich hast du bereits mehrjährige Berufserfahrung als Business / Financial / Data Analyst, als Management Consultant oder im Controlling mit Umsetzungsverantwortung.
Analytisches Denken und Freude an der Erfassung komplexer Prozess- und (Big) Data-Architekturen zeichnen dich aus.
Du hast fundierte Expertise in Reporting-Tools, wie Power BI, MicroStrategy oder Tableau, sowie in der Struktur von Data Warehouses und bringst gute Kenntnisse in SQL und Excel mit.
Deine Persönlichkeit überzeugt mit einer guten Balance aus Teamplay und Selbstverantwortung und du trittst souverän und kommunikationsstark auf.



Auf diese Versprechen kannst du zählen:



🕗 Flexibilität 🏖️
mobiles Arbeiten ● flexible Arbeitszeiten von 6-22 Uhr (Mo.-Fr.) ● Vollzeit entspricht einer 35-Stunden-Woche ● Gleitzeitkonto ● Langzeitkonto ● Teilzeit möglich ● 30 Tage Urlaub und frei am 24.12. & 31.12.
🤝 Kultur und Werte 🌈
Duz-Kultur ● New Work ● kein Dresscode ● Teamwork und Netzwerken ● Mut und Spaß an Weiterentwicklung ● klares Wertekonstrukt ● #WirSindAnders
💰 Gehalt und Vergünstigungen 🎁
hauseigener Tarifvertrag ● 13. Gehalt ● betriebliche Altersvorsorge ● vermögenswirksame Leistungen ● Urlaubs- und Freizeitangebote ● Zuschuss zum ÖPNV, Jobrad, Kindergarten oder mobilen Arbeiten ● Mitarbeitendenrabatte bei ca. 800 Unternehmen ● Lieferando for business ● Rabatte für unsere Bankprodukte und der Verbundpartner
💭 Gesundheit und Entwicklung 🎓
Sparda Stipendium ● Leadership-Talente-Programm ● Botschafter*innen Programm für Psychische Gesundheit ● Betriebliches Gesundheitsmanagement



Unsere Zusammenarbeit:



Sparringspartner*innen: Wir sind 10 weitere Kolleg*innen im Team Qualitätsmanagement und suchen nun dich als Verstärkung.
Wir garantieren dir eine intensive Einarbeitung, die remote möglich ist.
Durch regelmäßige Team-Jours fixes sichern wir den kontinuierlichen Austausch und die Vernetzung untereinander.
Wir stehen mit unseren Stakeholdern/Geschäftspartner*innen wie auch untereinander sowohl virtuell als auch in Präsenz im Kontakt. Dadurch entsteht für dich Flexibilität in der Wahl deines Arbeitsorts.



So geht es für dich weiter:



Wir wertschätzen Vielfalt und begrüßen daher alle Bewerbungen – unabhängig von Geschlecht, kultureller und sozialer Herkunft, Religion, Weltanschauung, Behinderung, Alter oder geschlechtlicher Identität. Auf ein Foto bei deiner Bewerbung kannst du daher gerne verzichten. Wenn du uns in unserer Vielfalt ergänzen magst, bewirb dich – du bist herzlich willkommen! 

Dein Kontakt ist unsere Personalreferentin Recruiting Melanie Brückmann, Tel. 0170 24 66 286.







Show more

Title: Analyst (m/f/d) - Renewable Energy, Berlin (Ger.) or Baar (Switz.)
Description:
Company information:

GoldenPeaks Capital Trading is the commercial branch of GoldenPeaks Capital Holding, responsible for offtake structuring, Power Purchase Agreements’ (PPA) negotiations and commercialization of renewable production.




GoldenPeaks Capital is one of the fastest-growing independent green power producers in Eastern Europe. Fundamental to our ongoing success is broad value chain integration and consolidation at GoldenPeaks Capital. This ensures continuous success in reaching ambitious targets, due to a unique alignment of vision, planning and know-how.




We strive to promote renewable energy by offering innovative technologic as well as commercial solutions. We are aiming to develop, invest, build, and maintain our own large scale renewable power plants.




In the role as an Analyst, you will play a pivotal part in optimizing the company’s revenues by conducting market analysis, assessing risks, building market intelligence, and developing strategies and products to manage the portfolio and exposures effectively. You will leverage your analytical skills, attention to detail, and technical expertise to provide actionable insights. Collaboration with Portfolio Management, Origination, and external counterparties will be essential to your success.




Responsibilites include (but are not limited to):

Evaluate new business cases, including implementing new technologies, entering new markets, and launching new products.
Build and maintain a market intelligence framework to support data-driven decision-making.
Collaborate with Portfolio Management and Origination to identify, analyse, and implement opportunities to optimize risk-weighted revenues.
Monitor market developments and regulatory changes, reporting on potential impacts to the business.
Analyse and manage large datasets to uncover insights and drive enhanced decision-making processes.
Develop and maintain tools or models using programming languages like Python for business analysis.
Design and manage database queries and operations; experience with SQL or Azure platforms is a strong advantage.




Qualifications:

Essential:

Bachelor’s degree (or higher) in economics, finance, engineering, computer science, or a related field.
3+ years of experience in an analytical and/or business development role, ideally in the energy industry.
Commercial mindset with strong analytical and attention-to-detail skills.
Experience in working with big data operations and programming (Excel & Python preferred).
Critical thinking and the ability to work independently, taking ownership of tasks and initiatives.




Desirable:

Familiarity with database management tools such as SQL or Azure.
Proven ability to develop tools or models for business analysis.
Knowledge of energy markets and regulatory frameworks.




Additional information:

Berlin as a location would be preferred, but Baar, Switzerland would also be possible




Benefits:

Strategic Impact: Be a key player in shaping the company’s strategic decisions and driving its growth in dynamic markets.
Attractive (discretionary) bonus schemes to reward exceptional contributions.
Opportunity to work in an international, collaborative, and high-performing team.
Fast decision-making processes with direct feedback and the chance to see the tangible impact of your work.




For Berlin as location furthermore:

Attractive pension schemes
Subsidy to the Deutschlandticket
Office centrally located (and easily reachable) at the Potsdamer Platz
Fast-paced and dynamic environment where the learning curve is high
Boosting your overall health in form of fresh fruits, healthy snacks, coffee and tea

Title: Data Analyst (m/w/d) Pricing
Description:
DocMorris steht für kundenorientierte innovative Dienstleistungen und eine große Produktvielfalt rund um die digitale Gesundheitsversorgung. Sie reichen von der schnellen Terminvereinbarung für den Online-Arztbesuch auf der Telemedizin-Plattform von TeleClinic bis zur pharmazeutischen Beratung und Versorgung mit verschreibungspflichtigen und rezeptfreien Medikamenten sowie Gesundheitsprodukten aus Deutschlands bekanntester Online-Apotheke.

Hinzu kommt der Marktplatz mit einem breiten ergänzenden Sortiment von Heil- und Hilfsmitteln sowie Produkten aus den Bereichen Ernährung, Beauty und Familie. Damit schafft DocMorris für ihre Kundinnen und Kunden einen einfachen Zugang zu umfassenden Gesundheitsdienstleistungen an einem Ort mit nur einem Klick. Im Segment Deutschland erwirtschaftete die Schweizer DocMorris AG im Jahr 2023 mit über 9 Millionen aktiven Kundinnen und Kunden einen Außenumsatz von 976 Millionen CHF.

Aufgaben


Du entwickelst Reportings und erstellst Ad-hoc-Analysen zur Umsatz-, Margen- und Preisentwicklung sowie zum Erfolg unserer Promotions.
Auf dieser Basis erarbeitest Du Handlungsempfehlungen für strategische und taktische Pricing-Entscheidungen. Damit trägst Du maßgeblich zum Geschäftserfolg unserer Produkte im Bereich der freiverkäuflichen Arzneimittel bei.
Du entwickelst unsere Pricing-Prozesse weiter und wirkst mit bei der Optimierung unserer Pricing-Algorithmen. Dabei wendest Du auch komplexe Analysemethoden an.
Du arbeitest eng mit den Bereichen Online-Marketing, Category Management, Supply-Chain-Management und Einkauf sowie unserem Data-Team zusammen.



Qualifikation


Du verfügst über ein abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium in Mathematik, Statistik, Wirtschaftsinformatik oder Betriebswirtschaftslehre.
Ein kommerzielles Verständnis im Bereich E-Commerce, idealerweise im Bereich Pricing, rundet Dein Profil ab.
Du hast Kenntnisse im Umgang mit relationalen Datenbanken, hast bereits mit SQL gearbeitet und besitzt Erfahrungen mit BI- und Visualisierungstools (z.B. Tableau, Power BI, QlikView oder anderen).
Idealerweise hast Du bereits statistische Analysemethoden angewendet und mit gängigen Statistiksoftwarepaketen gearbeitet.
Du hast ausgeprägte analytische und konzeptionelle Fähigkeiten.
Du sprichst gutes Deutsch und gutes Englisch.



Benefits


Attraktive Vergünstigungen in diversen Shops über Corporate Benefits
Betriebliche Altersvorsorge mit attraktiven Arbeitgeberzuschüssen
30 Urlaubstage
Möglichkeit zur Teilnahme am Mitarbeiterbeteiligungsprogramm (Aktienoptionen)
Zugang zu eLearning-Plattformen wie LinkedIn Learning
Fairer Lohn für Festangestellte und Zeitarbeitnehmer sowie angemessene Vergütung von Praktika
Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten und regelmäßige Entwicklungsgespräche
Tolle Mitarbeiter-Events und jährliche Firmenfeiern
Wohlfühl-Arbeitsumgebung mit klimatisierten, hellen Büros. Ergonomisch eingerichtete Arbeitsplätze mit hochmoderner technischer Ausstattung.
Flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle und Homeoffice-Möglichkeiten
Gute Anbindung an den öffentlichen Nahverkehr



Gestalte mit uns das neue Gesund! Wir freuen uns auf Deine aussagekräftige Bewerbung!

Bei Fragen steht Dir Matthias Wegerle unter der Telefonnummer +49 (0)621 397316 654 gerne zur Verfügung.
Show more
HTML:
DocMorris steht für kundenorientierte innovative Dienstleistungen und eine große Produktvielfalt rund um die digitale Gesundheitsversorgung. Sie reichen von der schnellen Terminvereinbarung für den Online-Arztbesuch auf der Telemedizin-Plattform von TeleClinic bis zur pharmazeutischen Beratung und Versorgung mit verschreibungspflichtigen und rezeptfreien Medikamenten sowie Gesundheitsprodukten aus Deutschlands bekanntester Online-Apotheke.

Hinzu kommt der Marktplatz mit einem breiten ergänzenden Sortiment von Heil- und Hilfsmitteln sowie Produkten aus den Bereichen Ernährung, Beauty und Familie. Damit schafft DocMorris für ihre Kundinnen und Kunden einen einfachen Zugang zu umfassenden Gesundheitsdienstleistungen an einem Ort mit nur einem Klick. Im Segment Deutschland erwirtschaftete die Schweizer DocMorris AG im Jahr 2023 mit über 9 Millionen aktiven Kundinnen und Kunden einen Außenumsatz von 976 Millionen CHF.

Aufgaben

  • Du entwickelst Reportings und erstellst Ad-hoc-Analysen zur Umsatz-, Margen- und Preisentwicklung sowie zum Erfolg unserer Promotions.
  • Auf dieser Basis erarbeitest Du Handlungsempfehlungen für strategische und taktische Pricing-Entscheidungen. Damit trägst Du maßgeblich zum Geschäftserfolg unserer Produkte im Bereich der freiverkäuflichen Arzneimittel bei.
  • Du entwickelst unsere Pricing-Prozesse weiter und wirkst mit bei der Optimierung unserer Pricing-Algorithmen. Dabei wendest Du auch komplexe Analysemethoden an.
  • Du arbeitest eng mit den Bereichen Online-Marketing, Category Management, Supply-Chain-Management und Einkauf sowie unserem Data-Team zusammen.


Qualifikation

  • Du verfügst über ein abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium in Mathematik, Statistik, Wirtschaftsinformatik oder Betriebswirtschaftslehre.
  • Ein kommerzielles Verständnis im Bereich E-Commerce, idealerweise im Bereich Pricing, rundet Dein Profil ab.
  • Du hast Kenntnisse im Umgang mit relationalen Datenbanken, hast bereits mit SQL gearbeitet und besitzt Erfahrungen mit BI- und Visualisierungstools (z.B. Tableau, Power BI, QlikView oder anderen).
  • Idealerweise hast Du bereits statistische Analysemethoden angewendet und mit gängigen Statistiksoftwarepaketen gearbeitet.
  • Du hast ausgeprägte analytische und konzeptionelle Fähigkeiten.
  • Du sprichst gutes Deutsch und gutes Englisch.


Benefits

  • Attraktive Vergünstigungen in diversen Shops über Corporate Benefits
  • Betriebliche Altersvorsorge mit attraktiven Arbeitgeberzuschüssen
  • 30 Urlaubstage
  • Möglichkeit zur Teilnahme am Mitarbeiterbeteiligungsprogramm (Aktienoptionen)
  • Zugang zu eLearning-Plattformen wie LinkedIn Learning
  • Fairer Lohn für Festangestellte und Zeitarbeitnehmer sowie angemessene Vergütung von Praktika
  • Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten und regelmäßige Entwicklungsgespräche
  • Tolle Mitarbeiter-Events und jährliche Firmenfeiern
  • Wohlfühl-Arbeitsumgebung mit klimatisierten, hellen Büros. Ergonomisch eingerichtete Arbeitsplätze mit hochmoderner technischer Ausstattung.
  • Flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle und Homeoffice-Möglichkeiten
  • Gute Anbindung an den öffentlichen Nahverkehr

Title: (Senior) Associate Business Intelligence & Data Analytics (x/f/m)
Description:
Über Doctolib - Together, let’s build the healthcare we all dream of

Doctolib ist das führende europäische Scale-up im Gesundheitsbereich. Doctolib ist - auch nach französischen Recht - eine mission driven company mit zwei Missionen:


Gesundheitsfachkräfte stärken und ihnen ein besseres Arbeitsleben ermöglichen
Menschen zu helfen, gesünder zu leben und einen einfacheren und schnelleren Zugang zu medizinischer Versorgung zu haben



Seit der Gründung von Doctolib im Jahr 2013 schaffen wir Innovationen, indem wir ein vereintes Team mit Gesundheitsexperten bilden, Technologien entwickeln, die ihren Bedürfnissen entsprechen und greifbaren Wert schaffen. Mit Leidenschaft für die Transformation des Gesundheitswesens sind wir führend im Bereich digitaler Gesundheitstechnologien und streben danach, ein führendes KI-Unternehmen im Gesundheitswesen zu werden.

Mehr als 2.900 Doctolibers in Frankreich, Deutschland, Italien und den Niederlanden arbeiten an der Betreuung eines Netzwerks von mehr als 900.000 professionellen Anwendern und mehr als 90 Millionen Patienten.

Als Senior Analyst Business Intelligence & Data Analytics (x/f/m) unterstützt Du Monitoring und Analyse der Business Performance von Doctolib Deutschland in allen Funktionen, mit besonderem Fokus auf Wachstum, Effizienz und Nutzerzufriedenheit. Du bei der Vorbereitung strategischer Entscheidungen und dabei, unser operative Exzellenz durch datengestützte Erkenntnisse zu verbessern.

Deine Aufgaben


Business Performance Monitoring: Helfe bei der Entwicklung unser Business Performance Monitoring, um sicherzustellen dass wir jederzeit einen guten 360 Blick haben
Datengesteuerte Erkenntnisse: Analysiere komplexe Datensätze, um Trends, Chancen und Verbesserungsbereiche zu identifizieren und dem Managementteam Erkenntnisse zu liefern
Erweitere unsere Reportingsuite, indem du Reports und Datenprodukte z.B. in Tableau und MetaBase oder Salesforce baust
Kontinuierliche Verbesserung: Unterstütze Initiativen zu Prozessoptimierung und operativer Exzellenz und fördere eine Kultur der kontinuierlichen Verbesserung in der gesamten Organisation
Berichterstattung und Kommunikation: Erstelle und präsentiere Reports für das Führungsteam



Dein Profil


4+ Jahre Erfahrung in einer Business Performance Management als Data Analyst oder ähnlichen Rollen
Nachweisliche Erfolge bei der Nutzung von Datenanalysen zur Unterstützung von Geschäftsentscheidungen und zur Verbesserung der Performance
Starke analytische Fähigkeiten und die Fähigkeit, komplexe Daten zu klaren, umsetzbaren Erkenntnissen zu synthetisieren
Exzellente Kenntnisse von Datenanalysetools und Software (Tableau, MetaBase); Erfahrung mit Salesforce ist ein Plus
Erfahrung im Umgang mit Erfahrung in einem SaaS-Umfeld sowie von Performance Management in Marketing, Sales, Customer Success sind von Vorteil



Was wir Dir bieten


Ein strukturiertes Onboarding Programm - die Doctolib Academy
Ein Aktienoptionsprogramm für alle Doctoliber
28 Urlaubstage + 1 Tag zusätzlich für jedes vollendete Beschäftigungs-Kalenderjahr (max. 30 Tage)
Betriebliche Altersvorsorge
Erstattung der ÖPNV-Kosten
Eine vergünstigte Mitgliedschaft bei unserem Kooperationspartner Urban Sports Club
Angebote zur Unterstützung Deines mentalen Wohlbefindens durch Zugang zu Coaches und Psychologen in Zusammenarbeit mit moka.care
Das Doctolib Parent Care Programm, das extra Elternzeit (1 Monat), Eltern-Treffen und inspirierende Präsentationen enthält
Kontinuierliche Trainingsangebote zu verschiedenen Kompetenzen (z.B. Soft Skills, Fachkenntnisse & Know-how)
Verpflegungsgutscheine und gesunde Snacks im Büro, sowie regelmäßige Angebote zum Frühstück oder BBQ
Moderne, attraktive Büros, die zum Austausch einladen und das Wohlbefinden fördern
Regelmäßiges Teambuilding & weitere Veranstaltungen (Doctoberfest, Kids day…)



Der Interview-Prozess


Kennenlern-Interview mit Deinem Talent Partner
Interview mit Deinem Manager
Case Study
Finales Interview
Referenzgespräche



Job Details


Festanstellung / unbefristet
Vollzeit
Arbeitsort: Berlin
Startdatum: ab sofort
Arbeitsmodus: Hybrid



Wir verfolgen die Vision, die Gesundheit aller zu verbessern. Dies spiegelt sich auch im Recruiting wider. Wir evaluieren Bewerbungen ausschließlich auf der Grundlage von Qualifikation und Motivation. Diskriminierung wird bei uns nicht toleriert.

Je diverser unser Team und die Ideen sind, desto mehr wird unser Produkt die Gesundheit unserer Nutzer:innen verbessern können. Deshalb laden wir dich ein, dich bei uns zu bewerben, unabhängig von Geschlecht, Religion, Alter, sexueller Orientierung, ethnischer Herkunft oder Behinderung.

Um Chancengleichheit zu gewährleisten, kannst Du in deiner Bewerbung auf Angaben wie Fotos, Alter, etc. verzichten. Lass uns bitte wissen, welche Vorkehrungen wir treffen können, um Dich bestmöglich zu unterstützen. Wir freuen uns, mit Dir das Gesundheitswesen zu digitalisieren!

Alle bereitgestellten Informationen werden von Doctolib für das Bewerbungsmanagement verarbeitet. Für Details zur Datenverarbeitung klicke bitte hier.

Bei Fragen oder wenn Du Deine Rechte wahrnehmen möchtest, wende Dich bitte an hr.dataprivacy@doctolib.com.

Title: Data Engineer (f/m/d)
Description:
At Klang, we create products that inspire people to deepen their understanding of the emergent nature of society and collectively envision a better future.

At the heart of Klang is SEED, an accessible, persistent world in which players share a history and shape a future. We provide an environment for a broad audience to belong and develop relationships in a society simulation inspired by life itself.

We aspire to bring people together through engaging media experiences and by building strong communities.

It's a super exciting project, but in order for us to achieve a goal like this we are going to need a lot of help! From people just like you.

We're in search of a Data Engineer (f/m/d) who can play a pivotal role in creating, what we believe, will be the first MMO of its kind.

Who will you be working with?

As a Data engineer you will work in close collaboration with Data Analysts, Platform Engineers, and Game Engineers to create state-of-the-art, reliable and scalable pipelines for processing data from various internal and external sources. We need your expertise to enable us to make more data-informed decisions as a company.

This team works from our Klang HQ in Berlin.

What will you be doing?




Building, maintaining, and operating batch and streaming pipelines to ingest data into BigQuery from various sources: in-game tracking events, backend services, website analytics, advertising outlets, Discord, etc.
Implementing automated data testing within our pipelines to address and mitigate data quality issues, ensuring the reliability, accuracy, and trustworthiness of our business-critical KPIs.
Collaborating closely with Data Analysts to ensure they have the necessary tools and data sets to produce actionable insights.
Working with Platform Engineers to evolve our data infrastructure practices in line with our broader cloud infrastructure strategy on Google Cloud Platform.
Partnering with software engineers across the organization to help them adopt best practices for integrating with our data pipelines.


You could be the person we are searching for if you have…


Experience in building and operating data pipelines in a production environment.
Experience with Google Cloud Platform's data services, or the willingness to learn based on experience with comparable cloud providers like AWS or Azure.
Strong SQL skills for querying and transforming large datasets.
Proficiency in Python for data engineering tasks, including experience with tools like dbt or Apache Airflow.
A good understanding of up-to-date data engineering technologies and best practices.


Bonus points for…




Professional experience in the game industry.
Being a fan of large-scale MMOs.


Our benefits…



Klang HQ (Berlin)


An opportunity to work on a groundbreaking project with a lot of room for professional and personal development
Competitive salary and 27 days of paid vacation
3 months work from abroad policy
Monthly public transport travel ticket or co-contribution to e-bike/e-moped
Monthly company co-contributions to private pensions
Reimbursement for physical health activities
Employee Assistance Program, including mental health support, legal advice as well as support finding doctor's appointments
Mental health support
Flexible office hours (with core hours)
Hybrid working set-up (Monday-Wednesday in office and the rest of the week is flexible)
Monthly team events and activities
A dog-friendly office, adjustable standing desks, ergonomic chairs, and mobile aircon units for hot summers
Healthy snacks and drinks in the office
Virtual Stock Options (VSOP)


If you don't feel that you quite meet all the requirements above, but the position still excites you and you think you would love to work for Klang, reach out! We still want to hear from you.

We explicitly encourage applications from applicants from groups underrepresented in games/tech spaces. We value all kinds of backgrounds and walks of life.

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Product Analytics (m/w/d)
Description:
FIXING THE PLANET BY MAKING HOMES CARBON-FREE!

With €35 million in funding from top-tier investors such as COATUE, Foundamental & Target Global, we are working towards a future where climate-neutral buildings - simply & rapidly - become a reality. At Enter, we aggregate and analyze relevant building data so that homeowners can sustainably reduce their energy costs and increase the value of their property.

We believe in:


Common code access
No gatekeepers
Simplicity over industry standards
Embracing the small change
Each API is a product
Baked in quality



We’re looking for people with an entrepreneurial mindset who enjoy having the freedom to directly own and impact parts of the Enter product.

Deine Aufgaben


Create and maintain the product analytics dashboards and related KPIs, ensuring alignment with contract compliance and minimizing incidents.
Manage the lifecycle of all data products in our visualization tool Metabase, including decommissioning unused dashboards, aiming for less than 5% unused dashboards weekly.
Increase the weekly usage of Metabase to 80% within your crew.
Ensure the Metabase structure is organized and easy to navigate.
Take responsibility for the correctness of data, regardless of the origin of any issues.
Be a key resource for team members to improve their ability to read and interpret data effectively.



Dein Profil


You have extensive experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role, maintaining dashboards and KPIs (5+ years of experience)
You have advanced proficiency in managing data products in Metabase or similar platforms.
Experience with Product Analytic tools like Amplitude and Event based reportings is a plus.
You have a strong understanding of data lifecycle management, including cleaning up and decommissioning unused assets.
You have analytical skills and pay attention to detail, with a focus on data accuracy and quality.
You have excellent communication and collaboration skills to support crew leads and team members in understanding and using data.
You have the ability to combine technical data expertise with domain-specific knowledge.
You are fluent in English (German is a plus, but not required).



Benefits


Become part of one of Europe's fastest growing Climate Tech Startups - funded by Europe's best known VC's.
Attractive & competitive compensation.
Work with top talent in a dynamic environment.
Individual benefits: learning budget, Urban Sports Clubs membership, job ticket or daycare allowance.
Office with a direct view of the Spree River, with everything your heart desires.
Numerous team events, including weekly yoga.

Show more

  • Attractive & competitive compensation.
  • Work with top talent in a dynamic environment.
  • Individual benefits: learning budget, Urban Sports Clubs membership, job ticket or daycare allowance.
  • Office with a direct view of the Spree River, with everything your heart desires.
  • Numerous team events, including weekly yoga.

Title: Working Student Data & AI Controlling (f/m/d)
Description:
You have a passion for technology and want to make the world a greener place?

Then become a playmaker and join our team as Working Student Data & AI Controlling (f/m/d) at E.ON Digital Technology.

We play a key role in shaping the energy transition by leading E.ON's digital transformation across Europe. We explore new paths by developing ideas, breaking new ground, making visions reality, and bringing new technologies to life. We deliver sustainable technology solutions because…

… it’s on us to make new energy work!

As a working student (m/f/d) in this role, you will support the success of E.ON’s Data & AI initiatives by assisting with financial planning, operational processes, and data-driven decision-making.

Your Role - meaningful & rewarding


Time Tracking: Support the team to track their working hours and ensure accuracy
Process Documentation: Create and update process documentation for improved clarity and efficiency
Performance Dialog Preparation: Use PowerPoint to design and deliver compelling presentations for performance dialogues and strategic meetings
Planning and Reporting: Utilize tools like Excel, PowerQuery, and PowerBI to support planning and reporting processes with accurate and insightful analyses
Data Modelling: Assist in the creation and maintenance of data models to improve reporting and visualization capabilities



Your Profile - authentic & open-minded


Educational background: You are currently enrolled in a degree program in Economics, Business Administration, IT, Data Science, or a related field
Technical skills: Proficiency in PowerPoint and Excel, is essential. Familiarity with additional data analysis tools (e.g., PowerQuery, PowerBI, Tableau or Python) is a bonus
Attention to detail: A structured and precise approach to managing tasks and data
Creative mindset: Ability to create professional and visually engaging presentations
Communication skills: Strong verbal and written communication skills in English (German is a bonus)
Team player: Collaborative and proactive in working with diverse teams



Our Benefits – smart & useful


Experience flexibility: You can combine coming to the office and working from home flexibly. Thanks to our flexible working hours you can easily balance university and a job.
Advance your development: We grow and we want you to grow with us! We offer exciting tasks and individual learning opportunities.
Enjoy fair compensation: We recognize your contribution with a market-based remuneration.
Get connected: Take the opportunity to engage in our Digital Empowerment Communities for collaboration, learning, and network building.
Recharge your battery: You have 30 days of paid vacation per year plus Christmas and New Year's Eve off.



Do you have questions?

For further information please contact Recruitment EDT Germany (IT), EDT_Talent_Acquisition@eon.com.

Please understand that for data protection reasons we can only accept applications submitted via our portal. Unfortunately, we cannot consider application documents that reach us by email or post.

What you need to know:

Job Req ID: 234074

Contract type: Fixed Term

Working time: Part time

Company: E.ON Digital Technology GmbH

Location: Essen, Berlin, Frankfurt am Main, Hamburg, Hannover, München, Würzburg

Function area: Controlling; Finance/Accounting/Tax; IT/Digital

Title: Data Analyst (Fokus Marketing) w/m/d
Description:
Unser Performance Marketing Team treibt das Wachstum der SRH University erfolgreich voran. Strategie, Datenanalyse, Kreativität und Leidenschaft für die Aufgabe steigern unsere Interessenten- und Bewerberanfragen – sowohl qualitativ und quantitativ. Damit das auch zukünftig so bleibt und wir Entscheidungen datengetrieben treffen, möchten wir das Performance Marketing Team verstärken.

Wir suchen ab sofort eine:n Data Analyst:in (Fokus Sales & Marketing) (w/m/d) in Vollzeit.

Die ausgeschriebene Stelle kann an einem der SRH University Campus in z. B. Berlin, Heidelberg, Hamburg, Dresden, Köln, Hamm oder Fürth ausgeübt werden.

Deine Fragen Beantwortet

Philipp Dietrich | Teamleitung Performance Marketing | Telefonnummer: +49 30 515650 556

Als eine der größten privaten Hochschulen in Deutschland ist die SRH University der innovative Wegbegleiter für Studierende aus über 140 Nationen. Wir sind Teil des führenden Bildungs- und Gesundheitsanbieters SRH, der seit über 50 Jahren Menschen dabei unterstützt, ein selbstbestimmtes Leben zu führen. Wir lehren mit Leidenschaft und Kompetenz und stellen die berufliche und persönliche Entwicklung unserer Studierenden in den Mittelpunkt. An unseren zukunftsweisenden Campus bieten wir vielfältigste Studienprogramme und -modelle, Hand in Hand mit Wirtschaft und Praxis. Mit unserer innovativen und prämierten Didaktik CORE begleiten wir unsere Studierenden individuell auf ihrem Weg. Sie lernen praxisnah in kleinen Gruppen und interaktiven, projektbasierten Einheiten. Wir verstehen uns als internationale, diverse und interdisziplinäre Community. Wir gehören zur SRH - einem führenden Anbieter von Bildungs- und Gesundheitsdienstleistungen mit 17.000 Mitarbeitern. Die SRH betreibt private Hochschulen, Bildungszentren, Schulen und Krankenhäuser.

Wir Bieten


Work-Life-Balance | Ausgeglichene Work-Life-Balance durch mobiles Arbeiten und großzügiger sowie flexibler Arbeitszeitrahmen
Mobilität | Business Bike, Zuschuss zum Deutschlandticket
Weiterentwicklung | Coaching Pool, Elternkompass, Studienrabatt an der Mobile University und Mitarbeitendengespräche
Sparangebot | Corporate Benefits: Rabatt-Shop nur für Mitarbeitende
Ausstattung | Moderne Büro- und Seminarausstattung
Sicherheit | Betriebliche Altersversorgung und Wertkonto
Ehrenamt | #TeilDeinGlück und erhalte zusätzliche bezahlte Freizeit



Aufgabe


Analyse von Interessenten-, Bewerber- und Kundendaten, um Potentiale zu erkennen und Handlungsempfehlungen für Marketing, Vertrieb und Portfolio-Management abzuleiten
Konsolidierung von Daten und Abbau von Datensilos
Management der Schnittstellen zwischen unseren Systemen und externen Plattformen unter Einbeziehung aller Stakeholder (interne und externe Entwickler, Konzern-IT, Plattformbetreiber, Marketingleitung)
Unterstützung der Online-Marketing-Disziplinen bei der Performance-Optimierung der jeweiligen Kanäle
Web Analytics und datenschutzkonformes Conversion-Tracking zur Optimierung der Website-Performance
Datenmodellierung in neusten Datenbank-Technologien (Microsoft SQL Server, SAP) als Grundlage für smarte Entscheidungen
Überführung von bestehenden Business-Intelligence-Lösungen (z. B. in Excel o.ä.) in zeitgemäßere BI-Umgebungen
Erstellen von anwendergerechten Dashboards und grafische Aufbereitung für verschiedene Stakeholder, um komplexe Zusammenhänge greifbar zu machen
Unterstützung des Performance Marketing Teams nach Fähigkeiten in den Disziplinen SEA, SEO, Affiliate Marketing, Paid Social, Native Advertising sowie CRO
Deine passgenauen Zielgruppenselektionen für Marketing- und vertriebsmaßnahmen leisten einen entscheidenden Beitrag zu unserem Erfolg



Profil


Du bringst erste Berufserfahrung als Data Analyst oder im Bereich Business Intelligence mit
Du hast ein abgeschlossenes Studium in Wirtschaftsinformatik, BWL, Wirtschaftsingenieurwesen, Mathematik, Informatik oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung
Du denkst analytisch, ergebnisorientiert, handelst strategisch und optimierst datengetrieben
Du hast Freude daran, Lösungsansätze proaktiv und konsequent in die Umsetzung zu begleiten
Du bist versiert im Umgang mit Reporting-Systemen und MS-Office, insbesondere Excel, PowerBI und PowerPoint
Du bist integer und vertrauenswürdig, denn du arbeitest mit unserem höchsten Gut – unseren Kundendaten
Du bist beharrlich bei der Optimierung der Datenqualität
Du optimierst du Schnittstellen und stellst den Datenfluss sicher
Du kennst dich mit Werbe-KPIs und datengesteuerten Ansätzen zur Entscheidungsfindung aus
Du hinterfragst den Status Quo und bringst kreative Optimierungen ein
Verhandlungssicheres Deutsch und Englisch



Offene Fragen?

Ich helfe gerne weiter.

Sebastian Wilsch

Personalsachbearbeiter

Ludwig-Guttmann-Straße 6

69123 Heidelberg

LinkedIn Sebastian.Wilsch@srh.de +49 (0) 6221 6799-866

Wir betonen ausdrücklich, dass bei uns alle Menschen – unabhängig von Geschlecht, Nationalität, ethnischer und sozialer Herkunft, Religion / Weltanschauung, Behinderung, Alter sowie sexueller Orientierung – gleichermaßen willkommen sind. Bewerbende mit Behinderung werden bei gleicher fachlicher und persönlicher Eignung bevorzugt eingestellt.

Wir arbeiten in einer der schönsten Branchen – der Bildung. Mit viel Leidenschaft bereichern wir täglich das Leben unserer Studierenden sowie das Erreichen ihrer akademischen und persönlichen Ziele.

Möchtest Du diese Leidenschaft mit uns teilen? Dann werde Teil des SRH University Teams. Wir freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung! Bewirb dich direkt online mit Angabe der Kennziffer 13663, deines frühestmöglichen Eintrittstermins sowie deinem Gehaltswunsch.

Ein Unternehmen mit Geschichte und Werten

Die SRH ist ein Stiftungsunternehmen mit Angeboten in den Bereichen Bildung und Gesundheit. Die mehr als 17 000 Mitarbeiter:innen der SRH begleiten jährlich über 1,2 Millionen Menschen auf ihren individuellen Lebenswegen. Seit der Gründung 1966 setzt sie sich für die Weiterentwicklung des Bildungs- und Gesundheitswesens ein. Die SRH ist sich ihrer gesellschaftlichen Verantwortung seit jeher bewusst. Um für noch mehr Menschen neue Lebenschancen zu eröffnen, reinvestiert sie ihre Gewinne in die Zukunftsmärkte Bildung und Gesundheit. Sie gehört zu den Innovationsführern in diesen Bereichen und gestaltet gesellschaftliche Debatten aktiv mit – für eine menschliche und nachhaltige Gesellschaft.
Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Consumer & Market Insights (all genders)
Description:
THE ROLE & THE TEAM


The Consumer & Market Insights team plays a crucial role in shaping customer-centric strategies at Zalando. By focusing on in-depth analytics and research, the team uncovers valuable insights that inform decision-making and enhance our competitive edge. The understanding of consumer needs and behaviours enables more effective sales, marketing, product development, and overall business strategies.

As a Senior Data Analyst in the Brand & Satisfaction tracking sub-team, your goal is to shed light on what drives customer perception and behaviour, leveraging the wide variety of data sources at your disposal. You will act as the voice of our customers internally and support data-driven decisions to improve their experience.


INCLUSIVE BY DESIGN


At Zalando, our vision is to be inclusive by design. And this vision starts with our hiring - we do not discriminate on the basis of gender identity, sexual orientation, personal expression, ethnicity, religious belief, or disability status. You are welcome to leave out your picture, age, or marital status from your application. We only assess candidates on their qualifications and merit.

We want to provide you with a great candidate experience. Feel free to inform us of any accommodations you may need, so we can best support you throughout the hiring process.

do.BETTER - our diversity & inclusion strategy https //corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/dobetter-our-diversity-and-inclusion-strategy

Our employee resource groups https //corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/our-employee-resource-groups


WHAT WE’D LOVE YOU TO DO (AND LOVE DOING)




Connecting transactional data, onsite behavioural data and perception insights (derived from customer and panel surveys) to build a holistic understanding of our customers’ experience
Successfully leading and owning analytical projects by conducting descriptive, diagnostic and predictive analytics using state-of-the-art modelling techniques and deriving recommendations for our stakeholders.
Support more junior analysts with guidance and sparring, leveraging your knowledge and experience to raise the bar for analytics within the team




WE’D LOVE TO MEET YOU IF




University degree in economics, computer science, mathematics, statistics, or in a similar quantitative field
Proven track record of a minimum of 5 years in a highly analytical role, ideally in an e-commerce environment
Strong analytical skills and solid understanding of statistical methods, with the ability to extract meaningful insights from large and complex data sets
Solid programming skills in SQL and in Python, as well as experience with Google Analytics (BigQuery)
Previous experience with data visualisation tools (e. g. Microstrategy, Tableau, PowerBI) is a plus
Knowledge of time series forecasting and causality (causal inference and A/B testing) is considered a plus
Ability to concisely communicate the essence, conveying meaningful and relevant insights to analytical and non-analytical stakeholders alike
Excellent verbal and written English skills




OUR OFFER


Zalando provides a range of benefits, here’s an overview of what you can expect. Ask your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about what we offer.



Employee shares program
40% off fashion and beauty products sold and shipped by Zalando, 30% off Zalando Lounge, discounts from external partners
2 paid volunteering days a year
Hybrid working model with up to 60% remote per week, actual practice is up to each team to best support their collaboration
Work from abroad for up to 30 working days a year
27 days of vacation a year to start
Relocation assistance available (subject to prior agreement)
Family services, including counseling and support
Health and wellbeing options (including Gympass)
Mental health support and coaching available
Drive your development through our training platform and biannual peer-to-peer review



Learn all about Zalando and our values here https //jobs.zalando.com/en/?gh_src=22377bdd1us


Please note that all applications must be completed using the online form - we do not accept applications via email.
Show more

Title: Operations Data Analyst (d/f/m)
Description:
Our Story

Every year millions of people are either filing their taxes in fear or giving up on their tax refund altogether. We're working on fixing that. Our intuitive app enables anyone, regardless of education or background, to file their taxes with newfound confidence.

Spread across Germany, Spain, and the UK, the team at Taxfix Group with its brands Taxfix, Steuerbot, and TaxScouts, is a compassionate group of solution-finders. We speak our minds openly, and with over 400 professionals, including tax experts, developers, and IT security experts, we're rich in ideas and voices. The group has facilitated more than 3.5 billion euros in tax refunds for its customers since its founding in 2016.

Your Challenge

As our Operations Data Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in empowering our operations team with data-driven insights and scalable solutions. You'll lead the charge in building robust data models, crafting intuitive dashboards, and designing precise forecasting models that elevate operational efficiency and customer satisfaction. Collaborating across teams, you will ensure data accessibility and clarity, enabling informed decision-making at every level of the Taxfix Group.

Your Responsibilities


Structure and model operational data from diverse sources using tools like dbt and Snowflake, creating a scalable foundation for future growth.
Develop and maintain intuitive dashboards in Looker, empowering teams to access and monitor key performance indicators.
Design and refine forecasting models to analyze historical trends and predict future operations across multiple channels, aiding resource and headcount planning.
Analyze workload and operational data to identify optimization opportunities and provide actionable recommendations for improved team efficiency.
Explore customer behavior patterns to enhance satisfaction and effectively manage customer load.
Collaborate with the operations team to collect and prioritize data requirements, ensuring their critical needs are met promptly.
Act as the bridge between operations and technical teams, translating business needs into actionable insights and use cases for AI and LLM integration.


Your Profile


Minimum 2 years of experience in data analytics roles such as Data Analyst, BI Analyst, or Analytics Engineer.
Proficiency in SQL, with foundational experience in dbt for data modeling.
Familiarity with cloud data warehouses (e.g., Snowflake, BigQuery), BI tools (e.g., Looker, Tableau, PowerBI), and advanced spreadsheet functions.
Basic statistical understanding, especially related to forecasting
Analytical thinker with a strong business mindset and a results-driven approach.
Exceptional communication skills to simplify and convey complex concepts effectively.
Fluent in both German and English.
Experience with operations tools such as Zendesk or Intercom is a plus.


Why Taxfix?


A chance to do meaningful, people-centric work with an international team of passionate professionals.
Holistic well-being with free mental health coaching sessions and yoga.
A monthly allowance to spend on an extensive range of services that you can use and roll over as flexibly as you like.
Employee stock options for all employees—because everyone deserves to benefit from the success they help to create.
30 annual vacation days and flexible working hours.
A generous learning budget to support your personal and professional development and guidance from our internal L&D experts.
Work from abroad for up to six weeks every year. Just align with your team, and then enjoy your trip.
Plenty of opportunities to socialize as a team. In addition to internal tech meetups, our international team hosts regular get-togethers—virtually and in person when possible.
Free tax declaration filing, of course, through the Taxfix app—and internal support for all personal tax-related questions.
Have a four-legged friend in your life? We’re happy to have dogs join us in the office.


Excited? So are we. Learn more about Team Taxfix on our blog and get a glimpse of our culture.

At Taxfix, we believe that incredible things happen when you have a wealth of perspectives and experiences. We're proudly committed to equal employment and development opportunities no matter your gender, race, religion, age, sexual orientation, colour, disability, or place of origin. To help mitigate any potential unconscious biases, we ask that you refrain from including your picture, age, or marital status on your CV. Let your experiences speak for themselves.

Not sure if you meet all the requirements for this role? Please apply anyway. You might bring something special to the team that we hadn't considered previously.
Show more
HTML:
Our Story

Every year millions of people are either filing their taxes in fear or giving up on their tax refund altogether. We're working on fixing that. Our intuitive app enables anyone, regardless of education or background, to file their taxes with newfound confidence.

Spread across Germany, Spain, and the UK, the team at Taxfix Group with its brands Taxfix, Steuerbot, and TaxScouts, is a compassionate group of solution-finders. We speak our minds openly, and with over 400 professionals, including tax experts, developers, and IT security experts, we're rich in ideas and voices. The group has facilitated more than 3.5 billion euros in tax refunds for its customers since its founding in 2016.

Your Challenge

As our Operations Data Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in empowering our operations team with data-driven insights and scalable solutions. You'll lead the charge in building robust data models, crafting intuitive dashboards, and designing precise forecasting models that elevate operational efficiency and customer satisfaction. Collaborating across teams, you will ensure data accessibility and clarity, enabling informed decision-making at every level of the Taxfix Group.

Your Responsibilities

  • Structure and model operational data from diverse sources using tools like dbt and Snowflake, creating a scalable foundation for future growth.
  • Develop and maintain intuitive dashboards in Looker, empowering teams to access and monitor key performance indicators.
  • Design and refine forecasting models to analyze historical trends and predict future operations across multiple channels, aiding resource and headcount planning.
  • Analyze workload and operational data to identify optimization opportunities and provide actionable recommendations for improved team efficiency.
  • Explore customer behavior patterns to enhance satisfaction and effectively manage customer load.
  • Collaborate with the operations team to collect and prioritize data requirements, ensuring their critical needs are met promptly.
  • Act as the bridge between operations and technical teams, translating business needs into actionable insights and use cases for AI and LLM integration.

Your Profile

  • Minimum 2 years of experience in data analytics roles such as Data Analyst, BI Analyst, or Analytics Engineer.
  • Proficiency in SQL, with foundational experience in dbt for data modeling.
  • Familiarity with cloud data warehouses (e.g., Snowflake, BigQuery), BI tools (e.g., Looker, Tableau, PowerBI), and advanced spreadsheet functions.
  • Basic statistical understanding, especially related to forecasting
  • Analytical thinker with a strong business mindset and a results-driven approach.
  • Exceptional communication skills to simplify and convey complex concepts effectively.
  • Fluent in both German and English.
  • Experience with operations tools such as Zendesk or Intercom is a plus.

Why Taxfix?

  • A chance to do meaningful, people-centric work with an international team of passionate professionals.
  • Holistic well-being with free mental health coaching sessions and yoga.
  • A monthly allowance to spend on an extensive range of services that you can use and roll over as flexibly as you like.
  • Employee stock options for all employees—because everyone deserves to benefit from the success they help to create.
  • 30 annual vacation days and flexible working hours.
  • A generous learning budget to support your personal and professional development and guidance from our internal L&D experts.
  • Work from abroad for up to six weeks every year. Just align with your team, and then enjoy your trip.
  • Plenty of opportunities to socialize as a team. In addition to internal tech meetups, our international team hosts regular get-togethers—virtually and in person when possible.
  • Free tax declaration filing, of course, through the Taxfix app—and internal support for all personal tax-related questions.
  • Have a four-legged friend in your life? We’re happy to have dogs join us in the office.

Excited? So are we. Learn more about Team Taxfix on our blog and get a glimpse of our culture.

At Taxfix, we believe that incredible things happen when you have a wealth of perspectives and experiences. We're proudly committed to equal employment and development opportunities no matter your gender, race, religion, age, sexual orientation, colour, disability, or place of origin. To help mitigate any potential unconscious biases, we ask that you refrain from including your picture, age, or marital status on your CV. Let your experiences speak for themselves.

Not sure if you meet all the requirements for this role? Please apply anyway. You might bring something special to the team that we hadn't considered previously.

Title: Senior Data Analyst Marketing (f/m/x)
Description:
The role

As a Senior Data Analyst in the Marketing Analytics team, you will join the wider International Marketing Analytics. Your main focus will be on supporting your communication platform product team stakeholders which supports global CRM communications in HelloFresh in their decision making. You will be their key contact person regarding data and analytics questions. Your experience in analytics and related technologies, together with your excellent communication, stakeholder management and organisational skills will have a big impact on the company’s performance.

Above all, we are looking for people who will make HelloFresh better. We believe there are many different ways of developing skills and we love diverse experiences! So even if you don’t “tick all the boxes” but think you’d thrive in this role, we would really like to learn more about you.

What You’ll Do


Collaborate with Product and Commercial Leads in order to understand the strategic priorities for your domain and then execute against these with engaging work
Partner closely with the Product and Marketing organisation promoting a culture rooted in evidence-based decision making.
Communicate actionable insights clearly across the organisation highlighting the “so-whats” of your analyses in order to drive the growth of our business.
Explore and analyse customer behaviour, communication engagement and product performance data in order to detect growth opportunities for the HelloFresh digital product by improving user experience.


What You’ll Bring


Strong experience in quantitative analysis roles, ideally including having worked closely with product teams
Technical Expertise: Proficient in advanced SQL and foundational statistical tests.
Data Visualization Mastery: advanced knowledge of Tableau for crafting compelling visualisations that effectively communicate complex data
Analytical Confidence: Confidence in performing analysis with large datasets while avoiding the common pitfalls
Holistic Analytical Approach: Blend of analytical and critical thinking, complemented by strong presentation and communication skills
Outcome-Driven Professional: Results-oriented with the ability to transform problem statements into actionable analytical insights. Skilled at aligning stakeholders to implement actions that bring value to both the business and its customers
BI and A/B Testing Exposure: Familiarity with Business Intelligence (BI) tools and experience in A/B testing and analytics platforms, including Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, Optimizely, MixPanel, etc.


What We Offer

Elevate your lifestyle! Join one of Europe's fastest-growing tech powerhouses in a dynamic phase of expansion.


Immerse yourself in a diverse global community of 90+ nationalities.
Enjoy a competitive compensation package that goes beyond the norm, with perks like a HelloFresh- subsidized Pension Scheme, Berlin relocation support, and a Hybrid working model.
Elevate your lifestyle with exclusive discounts on your weekly HelloFresh box and office meals.
Invest in your growth with an annual learning & development budget, German language learning budget, and access to the HelloFresh Academy.
Plus, we've got your well-being covered with mental health support, transportation perks, and working-parent-friendly benefits. From our 24/7 gym access,wellbeing platforms like Headspace and Spill, to sabbatical leave options, HelloFresh is not just a workplace; it's a lifestyle of perks and possibilities!


Are you up for the challenge?

Please submit your complete application below including your salary expectations and earliest starting date.

After submitting an application our team will review this and get back to you within 5 business days.

JR102678

Title: Data Analyst with ML Experience (w/m/d)
Description:
We are Billie, the leading provider of Buy Now, Pay Later (BNPL) payment methods for businesses, offering B2B companies innovative digital payment services and modern checkout solutions. We are to create a new standard for business payments and have made it our mission to simplify the purchasing experience for all businesses making it a tool for growth. Our solutions are based on proprietary, machine-learning-supported risk models, fully digitized processes and a highly scalable tech platform. This makes us a deep-tech company building financial products, not the other way around. We love building simple and elegant solutions and we strive for automation and scalability.

About The Role

Billie’s Analytics team is at the heart of the company supporting multiple functions to make data-driven decisions. Analytics team works closely with all Product segments, and other departments by innovating, hypothesizing, strategizing and providing recommended actions to relevant stakeholders (Decision science, Business Development and Account Management, Collection and Underwriting teams, Customer support and Marketing) in an integrated, scalable, secure and compliant way to enable the company's sustainable growth.

We are looking for a diligent Data Analyst to join Billie’s Analytics team and contribute to the development and enhancement of Billie’s analytical capabilities.

In this role, you will have the chance to make a significant impact by leveraging data and analytics tools, will look for solutions, establish relationships to be able to guide business decisions within the company values and expectations, and contribute to the ongoing growth of our portfolio.

The role is for someone who is a self-starter, enjoys exploring data for insights to support strategic decision making, is passionate about building data structures, analyzing and reporting on key performance indicators, comfortable to work on operational matters, willing to develop expertise in fraud and credit risk prevention, has excellent communication and strong interpersonal skills, and is able to document effectively.

This is a unique opportunity for analysts who are eager to immerse themselves in the heart of fintech business, develop additional muscles, and grow within a fast-paced and dynamic environment. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, apply creative problem-solving skills, and drive business growth through data-driven strategies.

You Will


Perform analysis to develop a deep understanding of the product, and its usage, business processes, and to support business and research hypotheses, including A/B testing of product ideas, identifying new product and business opportunities
Support product segments in creating effective tracking and measurement plans to ensure the impact of new features align with our product strategy
Design data models as part of data solution to support reporting and analysis needs
Create, maintain and update dashboards and reports using BI tools to communicate insights effectively
Enhance data processes, identify gaps, and streamline data collection
Collect, consolidate, and closely track KPI metrics regarding Billie’s portfolio
Use statistics and ML concepts in developing actionable business solutionsPerform comprehensive data analysis and EDA to support Risk and Fraud systems optimization
Communicate and present recommendations and key insights to stakeholders and executives to drive business decisions and create an impact
Communicate issues in an independent and timely manner with appropriate internal and external partners


Who we are looking for


You have 5+ years of proven experience in data analytics, data engineering or quantitative analytics
Proficiency in writing structured and efficient SQL queries for large data sets
Proficiency in advanced data and analytics and statistical concepts, tools, and methodologies
Have prior experience building intuitive data visualizations and dashboards that influence business decisions, utilizing tools like Looker, Tableau, Mixpanel, or similar
Proven track record of managing complex initiatives with strong emphasis on data, providing actionable insights and tracking success of those initiatives
Able to communicate complex problems in a simple and relevant manner at all levels
Experience with translating analytical insights into data driven business prioritization
You have strong business acumen coupled with highly analytical mindset
You had the chance to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
Strong sense of responsibility, self-starter, well organized, good planner, able to work independently and meet deadlines
Experience with Python, R and other advanced analytical tools
Previously experience in a fraud, risk & payment management environment is an advantage


What We Offer


Challenging and impactful work that drives personal and professional growth
One of the best Virtual Shares Incentive Programs in the market, so that everyone at Billie is invested in our success
Flexible work hours and trust in your ability to deliver, empowering you to take control of your work-life balance
A hybrid working approach that allows you to work from home for up to 3 days per week
Enjoy 30 days vacation per year on top of paid public holidays, sabbatical opportunities, and extra child sickness leave for parents
Our “Catch a Ride with Billie” program that enables discounted access to Berlin Public Transport (BVG), Deutschland-Ticket, OR JobRad
A yearly development budget to broaden your skill set and horizons
Free German group classes
An English-speaking, multicultural team with more than 40 nationalities represented
Building meaningful connections with your colleagues through company and team events, interest groups, the Billie run club, game nights, and more, powered by our Formula Fun Team!
Great office space at Checkpoint Charlie with free gym access, barista coffee, drinks and more


Billie offers you the opportunity to be a part of one of the fastest-growing Fintech startups in Europe following the mission to innovate to create new freedom for businesses of all sizes. Our combined decades of experience in B2B Financing and Payments in a market thirsty for innovation and change make this a fantastic possibility to get into the most dynamic space in tech.

Join an international team of talented, passionate people where drive and merit matter. We work in nimble, cross-functional teams with open communication lines across the company. You’ll be surrounded by smart people from a wide variety of backgrounds from which you can learn and that want to learn from you.

Are you ready to join Billie?

Billie is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment in our workplace. By embracing talents and abilities of all kinds, we aim to boost motivation and team creativity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, age, marital status, gender, political views, beliefs, sexual orientation, color, disability status, or any other demographic factors.
