Title: Data Analyst, In-line Inspection (ILI)
Description:
Your Job

DarkVision, part of Koch Engineered Solutions, is seeking a Data Analyst for our Pipeline In-line Inspection (ILI) Data Analysis team.




DarkVision uses state-of-the-art proprietary acoustic imaging technologies to provide asset inspection services to industrial clients. This ultrasound system gathers immense datasets and identifies defects as small as a few millimeters. Automated processing, measurement, classification, and visualization algorithms are crucial due to the time-consuming and inconsistent nature of manual processing.




In this role, you will interpret ultrasound data obtained from DarkVision’s Pipeline Inline-Inspection (ILI) tool to produce accurate and reliable inspection reports, essential for the safe operation of oil and gas pipelines. You will be responsible for identifying and annotating features within ultrasound imaging data, creating visualizations, and generating client reports.




Our experts from across the machine vision, imaging, computer graphics, and data analytics sectors have worked to create the most technologically advanced platform for pipeline and downhole diagnostics. Come join our team as we embark on the exciting journey ahead to become the global leader in industrial imaging.




***This position is full-time on-site in our HQ in North Vancouver, BC. While this position will start in our Research & Innovation team, you will eventually transition to a dedicated ILI Data Analysis position within the Data Team.***




Our Team

Our Data Analysts utilize 3D data visualization software and human-in-the-loop machine learning processes to meticulously analyze ultrasound datasets. The outputs of these analyses result in critical insights that enable our clients to make data-informed decisions on the operations and maintenance of multi-million-dollar energy infrastructure assets.




What You Will Do

Inspect ultrasound data to identify and annotate features and defects.
Create 3D visualizations and renderings from raw ultrasound data.
Generate and edit detailed reports for client delivery.
Help define processes and training for the ILI data analysis team.




Opportunities To Learn and Work On:

Contribute to process automation and client reporting.
Become a Subject Matter Expert (SME) in pipeline Non-Destructive Evaluation/Testing (NDE/NDT) integrity inspection.




Who You Are (Basic Qualifications)

Experience in at least one of:
Ultrasound- or acoustics-based asset integrity data management or analysis.
Pipeline inspection services and data analysis.
Upstream oil and gas production or processing.
Experience in quality control processes and preparing client-facing reports.




What Will Put You Ahead

Professional experience programming in Python.
Experience in developing analyses, code, and dashboards to automate and enhance processes in an industry application.
Experience in ILI or NDE/NDT
Experience in the Oil & Gas industry
Experience gathering, evaluating, and investigating image/computer vision data
Experience working with spatial or GIS data
Demonstrated ability as a self-starter and independent contributor, adept at efficiently and proactively managing new tasks.




General Salary Range

For this role, we anticipate paying $30 to 38 per hour. This role is eligible for variable pay, issued as a monetary bonus or in another form.




At Koch companies, we are entrepreneurs. This means we openly challenge the status quo, find new ways to create value and get rewarded for our individual contributions. Any compensation range provided for a role is an estimate determined by available market data. The actual amount may be higher or lower than the range provided considering each candidate's knowledge, skills, abilities, and geographic location. If you have questions, please speak to your recruiter about the flexibility and detail of our compensation philosophy.




Who We Are

DarkVision Technologies Inc. is a Canada-based tech company disrupting the industrial imaging market since 2013. We have created the world’s most advanced acoustic-based imaging platform. We are packaging it into multiple new product lines, revolutionizing how our clients quantify and visualize the integrity of their critical assets.




Backed by Koch Industries, one of the world’s largest privately held companies, DarkVision’s team of Mechanical, Skunkworks, Electrical, Software, and Machine Learning Engineers is rapidly expanding to meet the demand for the company’s current and upcoming products.




We allow employees to work on cutting-edge technologies that blend science with real-world applications. We invite you to join our team for the exciting journey ahead as we become the global leader in industrial imaging.




At Koch, employees are empowered to do what they do best to make life better. Learn how our business philosophy helps employees unleash their potential while creating value for themselves and the company.




Additionally, everyone has individual work and personal needs. We seek to enable the best work environment that helps you and the business work together to produce superior results.




How To Apply

If you have the above qualifications, we would like to hear from you. We thank all applicants in advance, but please be advised that only those selected for an interview will be contacted.




We are an equal opportunity employer. If you require accommodation or assistance at any time during the application or selection processes, please submit a request by following the directions located in the FAQ section at the bottom of the kochcareers.com webpage.




Successful candidates will be required to complete a criminal background check.




Keywords: ILI, in-line inspection, NDE, NDT, non-destructive testing, non-destructive evaluation, pipeline, integrity, well, logging, analysis, analyst, reporting, reports, ultrasound, ultrasonic, acoustic, 3D, computer vision, visualization, rendering, Python

Title: Data Analyst (0 Experience Required)
Description:
For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.




At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.




As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.




With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.




So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!




Benefits

Work up to 20 hours per week.
Earn a competitive rate of pay.
Develop your research skills.
Avoid the long commute.
Work from the comfort of your home office.
Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!




Ideal Candidate

Fluent in English
Excellent research skills.
Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Canada.
Analytical mindset.




Job Requirements

Must be living in Canada for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
All work must be of an independent nature.




Apply Online Today!

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Quality Verification
Description:
The Sr. Data Analyst role develops business intelligence products and leads data initiatives to enhance data maturity for our Quality Verification teams. You will use your advanced technical knowledge of SQL programming, ETL pipeline development, and data visualisation tools to analyse data and identify trends, driving decision-making across our organisation.

You will report to the Senior Analytics Manager.

What You Will Do


You will define the data analytics roadmap for some of EA's largest titles.
You will use your technical skills to develop data products that improve decision-making across the Quality Verification organization.
You will define best practices in data analytics and visualization tools.
You will create data governance practices to improve our organisation's data maturity.
You will provide coaching for Data Analyst colleagues.


The Next Great Senior Data Analyst Requires


3+ years of professional analytical experience.
Advanced SQL skills and practical experience in other languages such as R, SAS, or Python.
Able to develop data modelling and warehousing solutions.
Able to plan and prioritise multiple concurrent projects.
Able to foster working relationships with partners.


COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS The ranges listed below are what EA in good faith expects to pay applicants for this role in these locations at the time of this posting. If you reside in a different location, a recruiter will advise on the applicable range and benefits. Pay offered will be determined based on a number of relevant business and candidate factors (e.g. education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, geographic location, or business needs). BASE SALARY RANGES


British Columbia (depending on location e.g. Vancouver vs. Victoria)
$89,300 - $123,000 CAD

In British Columbia, we offer a package of benefits including vacation (3 weeks per year to start), 10 days per year of sick time, paid top-up to EI/QPIP benefits up to 100% of base salary when you welcome a new child (12 weeks for maternity, and 4 weeks for parental/adoption leave), extended health/dental/vision coverage, life insurance, disability insurance, retirement plan to regular full-time employees. Certain roles may also be eligible for bonus and equity.

HTML:
The Sr. Data Analyst role develops business intelligence products and leads data initiatives to enhance data maturity for our Quality Verification teams. You will use your advanced technical knowledge of SQL programming, ETL pipeline development, and data visualisation tools to analyse data and identify trends, driving decision-making across our organisation.

You will report to the Senior Analytics Manager.

What You Will Do

  • You will define the data analytics roadmap for some of EA's largest titles.
  • You will use your technical skills to develop data products that improve decision-making across the Quality Verification organization.
  • You will define best practices in data analytics and visualization tools.
  • You will create data governance practices to improve our organisation's data maturity.
  • You will provide coaching for Data Analyst colleagues.

The Next Great Senior Data Analyst Requires

  • 3+ years of professional analytical experience.
  • Advanced SQL skills and practical experience in other languages such as R, SAS, or Python.
  • Able to develop data modelling and warehousing solutions.
  • Able to plan and prioritise multiple concurrent projects.
  • Able to foster working relationships with partners.

COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS The ranges listed below are what EA in good faith expects to pay applicants for this role in these locations at the time of this posting. If you reside in a different location, a recruiter will advise on the applicable range and benefits. Pay offered will be determined based on a number of relevant business and candidate factors (e.g. education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, geographic location, or business needs).   • British Columbia (depending on location e.g. Vancouver vs. Victoria)
    • $89,300 - $123,000 CAD
In British Columbia, we offer a package of benefits including vacation (3 weeks per year to start), 10 days per year of sick time, paid top-up to EI/QPIP benefits up to 100% of base salary when you welcome a new child (12 weeks for maternity, and 4 weeks for parental/adoption leave), extended health/dental/vision coverage, life insurance, disability insurance, retirement plan to regular full-time employees. Certain roles may also be eligible for bonus and equity.

Title: Data & Insights Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Move Beyond! To move people forward in life - We are the people behind Cathay Pacific. We are proud of our Hong Kong heritage but equally proud of the global, diverse workforce that makes us who we are. We are relentlessly driven to create lifetime customer loyalty, value for our shareholders and satisfaction and enrichment for our employees. We are a complex global business, but we are also family. And whether we are in the cockpit or behind a desk, moving cargo, checking our passengers in or ensuring they are safe and comfortable while in the air, we are all one team, focused on delivering one world-class airline operation. Join us and discover just how far you can go!

Role Introduction

The Data & Insight Analyst is responsible for the analysis, implementation and

performance management of the region. The role is also responsible for optimization of

Corporate, Agency and Digital sales programs.

In this role, you will support the end-to-end regional commercial strategy planning

process, starting from goal setting, initiatives formulation to implementation and tracking, with the aim to drive revenue across different customer segments and distribution channels. You will use data analytical tools (both internal and external) to perform analysis and provide commercial teams (i.e. Regional Marketing, Digital, Sales teams) with actionable insights that helps to identify revenue opportunities. You will also be responsible for measuring the success of all sales or go-to-market activities, as well as sharing all learnings with respective stakeholders for future improvements.)

Key Responsibilities

Business Planning


Support Head Office (Revenue Management, Sales & Distribution, Digital) and Regional Teams on end-to-end business planning process, from developing strategic commercial strategy, campaigns/initiatives planning to execution and performance tracking.
Consolidate local market intelligence or any sales opportunities (e.g. MICE, special group movements) and share/discuss with Head Office with proposed plan to win deals with high success rates and incremental revenue.
Assist in developing targeted and customer-centric incentives action plans that are competitive in the local markets within assigned budget.
Support local sales teams in tracking incentives performance, business development or up-/cross-selling activities so that CX remains as the preferred choice for the trade partners and for our customers.
Observe market activities and brainstorm with local stakeholders to design customized products for targeted customer segments, and collaborate with Head Office for new product launch.
Assist Head of Business Insights and Analytics to formulate commercial budget plan.
Assist in formulating and ensuring the achievement of the offline market distribution strategy for the region (if applicable).
Assist in devising strategy to improve value of incentives and NDC remunerations in the region.


Analytics Champion


Act as the analytics champion for the region – i.e. well-versed with all in-house and external data analytical tools (i.e. DDS, QlikSense, PRISM).
Assist in analyzing data, develop reports, draw inferences and provide actionable insights to Regional Sales Teams, including new trends/customer purchase behaviors, new sales opportunities and areas of improvements.
Own the performance tracking of all campaigns/ initiatives with clear and defined metrics; identify learning points and continue to improve so as to achieve the target.
Drive adoption of all analytical tools and cultivate data-driven culture within the Regional and Outport teams.
Assist in conducting ad-hoc commercial studies and support Head Office-driven analytics projects when required.


Pricing and Fare Filing


Provide local-specific insights in the formulation of pricing strategies with Head Office Revenue Management Team. Monitor the effectiveness of the pricing strategies and initiate change discussions when needed.
Responsible for year-round proactive campaign planning process – i.e. developing campaign proposals, benchmarking, market insights and campaign tracking.
Review and analyze local market Corporate discount parameters, Global Specialty products (i.e. students/MICE/Seamen/Cruise).
Manage communications with local sales teams on fare changes, fare conditions revision, new products/campaigns launches and/or any government fares filing (if required).
Assist with checking new live fares on GDS to ensure 100% accuracy and troubleshooting of any fare auto-pricing errors.
Manage ad-hoc fare proposal and requests.


E&A


Emergency and Accident and Crisis Response responsibilities as required.


Requirements

Academic Qualifications


Post-Secondary Diploma / Certificate or equivalent combination of education, training, and experience preferably in a relevant Sales and Marketing or Business field is required with minimum 2+ years’ experience in data analysis


Knowledge, Skills, Training And Experience


Experience in, or knowledge of, the airline industry is preferred
Strong numeric and statistical analytical skills are essential
Able to present analysis clearly with findings and actionable insights
Demonstrated positive and innovative learning attitude, problem-solving skills and stakeholder management
Knowledge of airline/travel management systems including DDS, MIDT and PRISM is an advantage
Practical experience with any analytical tools (i.e. QlikSense, Tableau, QlikView) is an advantage
Expert knowledge of MS Suite of tools


Additional Requirements


Must successfully pass reference checks
Must be willing and able to sit for long periods of time
Must be willing and able to travel, if required
Must have the right to live in work in Canada


Benefits

Cathay Pacific Airways is proud to offer eligible employees competitive Compensation & Benefits package, as varied by location, regularly scheduled hours worked, length of employment and employment status as highlighted below.


Travel Privileges on Cathay Pacific Airways Global Network
Extensive well-being programs including health, dental, prescription, vision, virtual doctor visits and flexible spending accounts and employee assistance program benefits to help you stay well.
Pension Matching Program
Paid Holiday & Vacation
LTD & Basic Life Insurance
If this position requires a uniform, a uniform allowance will be provided
To learn more about Cathay Pacific as a Certified Great Place Employer – Please Click Here


Personal & Application Information

Cathay Pacific Airways Limited is committed to employment equity, supports diversity in the workplace and encourages application from all qualified individuals including women, members of visible minorities, Aboriginal peoples and persons with disabilities. Personal data provided by job applicants will be used strictly in accordance with our personal data policy and for recruitment purposes only. A copy of our Personal Information Collection Statement will be provided upon request by contacting our Data Protection Officer.

If you require assistance or an accommodation in completing any aspect of the application process, please contact the Cathay Americas Recruiting team at: jobs@cathaypacific.com.

  • Expert knowledge of MS Suite of tools

  • Must successfully pass reference checks
  • Must be willing and able to sit for long periods of time
  • Must be willing and able to travel, if required
  • Must have the right to live in work in Canada

Benefits

Cathay Pacific Airways is proud to offer eligible employees competitive Compensation & Benefits package, as varied by location, regularly scheduled hours worked, length of employment and employment status as highlighted below.

  • Travel Privileges on Cathay Pacific Airways Global Network
  • Extensive well-being programs including health, dental, prescription, vision, virtual doctor visits and flexible spending accounts and employee assistance program benefits to help you stay well.
  • Pension Matching Program

  • LTD & Basic Life Insurance
  • If this position requires a uniform, a uniform allowance will be provided

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
About Us

Chainlink Labs is the primary contributing developer of Chainlink, the decentralized computing platform powering the verifiable web. Chainlink is the industry-standard platform for providing access to real-world data, offchain computation, and secure cross-chain interoperability across any blockchain. Chainlink Labs helps power verifiable applications for banking, DeFi, global trade, and gaming by collaborating with some of the world’s largest financial institutions, notably Swift, DTCC, and ANZ. Chainlink Labs also works with top Web3 teams, including Aave, Compound, GMX, Maker, and Synthetix. Chainlink Labs was ranked in Newsweek’s 100 Most Loved Workplaces 2023 in both the United States and United Kingdom.

We are looking for a skilled and motivated Data Engineer to drive the development of Chainlink’s public-facing dashboard. This dashboard will serve as a key resource for the Web3 community, showcasing metrics that highlight the performance, adoption, and impact of the Chainlink Network. The ideal candidate will have strong technical expertise in data engineering combined with a deep understanding of the blockchain and Web3 space.

In this role, you will take ownership of defining the metrics to be displayed, building the logic to calculate these metrics, and creating robust data pipelines to ensure their delivery. You’ll be responsible for the accuracy, quality, and timeliness of these metrics, while also contributing insights into how these metrics should reflect the unique aspects of the blockchain ecosystem.

Your Impact


Collaborate with stakeholders to define and prioritize metrics for the dashboard.
Build logic to calculate metrics such as transaction volume, total value secured, and staking activity.
Design and maintain ETL pipelines to process blockchain data and ensure seamless delivery to the dashboard.
Ensure high data quality and timeliness through monitoring, validation, and debugging processes.
Provide insights into blockchain-specific metrics, differentiating between concepts such as transaction volume vs. locked value and understanding diverse protocol types (e.g., perpetuals vs. lending protocols).
Act as a subject matter expert in blockchain data, helping teams interpret the difference between decentralized applications (Dapps) and smart contracts. Partnering with GTM and Marketing which makes understanding metrics and blockchain is important.


Requirements


Proven experience in data engineering, with expertise in ETL processes, cloud platforms (e.g., GCP, AWS), and tools like Apache Airflow, SQL, and Python.
Strong knowledge of blockchain fundamentals, including smart contracts, decentralized applications, and protocol types.
Familiarity with Web3 metrics, such as transaction volume, TVL (Total Value Locked), staking, and protocol usage data.
Excellent ability to collaborate across cross-functional teams, including data science, product, and engineering.
Passion for Web3, blockchain, and decentralized ecosystems.


Join our team to craft the data backbone of Chainlink’s public narrative, providing the Web3 community with the insights they need to understand and trust the value of decentralized systems!

All roles with Chainlink Labs are global and remote-based. Unless otherwise stated, we ask that you try to overlap some working hours with Eastern Standard Time (EST).

Commitment to Equal Opportunity

Chainlink Labs is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment in compliance with applicable laws, regulations, or ordinances. If you need assistance or accommodation due to a disability or special need when applying for a role or in our recruitment process, please contact us via this form.

Global Data Privacy Notice for Job Candidates and Applicants

Information collected and processed as part of your Chainlink Labs Careers profile, and any job applications you choose to submit is subject to our Privacy Policy. By submitting your application, you are agreeing to our use and processing of your data as required.
Show more

Title: Data Analytics Co-op
Description:
Co-op Start Date: April 14, 2025

Duration: 8 months

Positions available: 1

Are you eager to get hands-on experience with innovative talent technology tools used by a global company? This is your chance! As a Co-op student on our Global Talent Technology & Attraction team based in Vancouver, you'll be at the forefront of supporting multiple geographically dispersed client groups. Gain valuable experience in application configuration, deployment, data analysis, and operational support, impacting the entire employee lifecycle!

Our ideal candidate has a high level of attention to detail and can use their data analysis skills to identify areas for process optimization. Their technical background in data preparation, analysis and visualization will be instrumental in creating insightful Power BI dashboards to support our global client groups.

Responsibilities


Evaluate, configure, deploy, and support commercial off-the-shelf (COTS) products, while resolving critical application errors and incoming support tickets.
Gather, extract and clean data from various sources, ensuring data integrity and quality.
Analyze large datasets using statistical methods and data visualization tools to identify patterns, trends, and opportunities for improvement.
Convert data-driven insights into practical business suggestions, assisting collaborators in comprehending and addressing key challenges and opportunities.
Build visually appealing and insightful data visualizations in Power BI to communicate sophisticated data analysis results to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and reliability by conducting regular data audits and performing validation checks.
Continuously seek and implement improvements in data collection, analysis, and reporting to enhance overall efficiency and effectiveness.


Qualifications


Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s program in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field.
Proficient in Python, with experience in libraries such as pandas, NumPy, matplotlib, and seaborn for data manipulation and visualization.
Basic knowledge of relational databases and SQL for data querying.
Experience creating dashboards and reports using Power BI or similar business intelligence tools.
Experience in front-line customer service or technical support, with superb communication skills to convey technical concepts to non-technical collaborators.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to tackle challenges and seek guidance when needed.
Must be enrolled in a recognized and accredited co-op program at a Canadian post-secondary institution throughout the duration of the term, available for full-time work, and willing to relocate to Vancouver, BC if currently studying outside of Metro Vancouver.


Nice to Have


Understanding of how to use RESTful APIs. Familiarity with authorization frameworks (e.g., OAuth 2.0, SAML 2.0, SCIM).
Solid understanding of Agile methodologies and their benefits, enabling effective collaboration, adaptability, and continuous improvement within a team environment.
Familiarity with Azure DevOps and other agile tools for project management.


Why consider Teck Resources Limited for your Co-op Placement?

At Teck, we offer more than just a job – we provide a comprehensive student experience comprised of relevant, hands-on work, vibrant social activities, extensive networking opportunities, and rich professional development. With captivating projects set against stunning backdrops, a culture of inclusivity and collaboration, and boundless opportunities to learn, grow, and have fun, joining us means embracing a fulfilling and dynamic co-op adventure.

In addition to excellent compensation, Teck co-ops receive a variety of advantages including but not limited to: 


Financial assistance to help with travel costs and co-op fees
Opportunity to develop technical skills and gain practical experience while applying academic knowledge to real-world mining operations and projects
Enjoy mentorship and guidance from experienced specialists in their respective fields
Receive primary consideration for professional positions upon graduation


Salary Range: $3900 - $4900 / Month

Salary is commensurate with the number of academic semesters and prior co-op experiences completed.

About Teck

At Teck, we value diversity. Our teams work collaboratively and respect each person’s unique perspective and contribution.

Teck is one of Canada's leading mining companies, focused on providing products that are essential to building a better quality of life for people around the globe.

Our commitment to our people is why Teck has been named one of Canada’s Top 100 Employers for seven consecutive years, listed as one of Canada's Top Employers for Young People and named to the 2024 Bloomberg Gender-Equality Index.

The pursuit of sustainability guides Teck's approach to business and we are proud to be recognized as one of the 2024 Global 100 Most Sustainable Corporations by Corporate Knights.

Headquartered in Vancouver, Canada, its shares are listed on the Toronto Stock Exchange under the symbols TECK.A and TECK.B and the New York Stock Exchange under the symbol TECK.

Learn more about Teck at www.teck.com or follow @TeckResources.

We wish to thank all applicants for their interest and effort in applying for the position; however, only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.

Title: Business Insights Analyst
Description:
Marketing Statement

Join a company that has been a part of moving Metro Vancouver for over 35 years.

British Columbia Rapid Transit Company Ltd. (BCRTC) maintains and operates the Expo and Millennium SkyTrain Lines from our central facilities in south Burnaby. Our services connect downtown Vancouver to the cities of Burnaby, New Westminster, Coquitlam, Port Moody and Surrey. With the future expansion of both the Expo and Millennium Lines gathering pace, infrastructure renewal and new asset acquisition projects underway, this is an exciting time to join our team of over 1,200 dedicated employees, working on one of the longest fully-automated rapid transit systems in the world.

Our work encompasses roles such as administration, engineering, elevator and escalator maintenance, field operations, vehicle maintenance, and wayside (station and guideway) maintenance.

When you work for SkyTrain, not only will you help move Metro Vancouver, you will also have access to comprehensive benefits including paid vacation, medical benefits, transit passes, training and more. We are a proud equal opportunity employer, committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce.

Come explore what makes us one of BC’s Top Employers!

Responsibilities

PRIMARY PURPOSE

Develops, coordinates and maintains performance measures across the organization to ensure alignment with corporate

goals and objectives. Prepares a variety of analyses and reports to provide accurate and up-to-date information to the

management team.

Develops and maintains end-to-end data and analytics solutions to meet BCRTC’s business needs and support data-driven decision-making strategies. This includes identifying analytical goals and objectives through stakeholder engagement, developing data collection solutions, creating automated Extract-Transform-Load (ETL) processes, generating meaningful performance insights, and communicating analytical insights to various stakeholders through data visualization tools and data storytelling.

Key Accountabilities

Performance Measures & Continuous Improvement:

Collaborates with departments to explore data requirements and works with relevant managers/supervisors to develop business performance tracking and analytical solutions across all functions. Engages with relevant stakeholders in requirements gathering, data tracking, report design, delivery and sustainment.

Investigates and analyzes statistics and underlying causes and trends of business performance. Prepares periodic reports indicating business performance compared to targets and the previous year(s), and rationale for variances. Supports all corporate KPI reporting activities for various levels of management, BCRTC Board of Directors, and TransLink.

Establishes and maintains data collection, verification, and reporting processes which ensures timeliness, accuracy, and completeness of the analytical insights. Ensures solutions are reliable and comply with company’s standards, policies, processes, regulatory and other related requirements.

Leverages available benchmarking resources for best practices and provides comparable performance measures from other transit agencies and business enterprises to the concerned stakeholders towards informed decision making. Participates in annual benchmarking KPI data submission activities.

Supports corporate data & insights-driven initiatives and business planning activities as needed, e.g. Annual Performance Target Setting, Data Quality Improvement, Data Value Creation Initiatives and Data Management framework.

Supports the design, implementation, and maintenance of pipelines for data integration and ETL/ELT on modern data platforms such as Microsoft Azure Synapse, Fabric, and PowerBI.

Supports the manager to produce reports and statistical analyses for targeted areas in response to requests from media, Freedom of Information requests, Executive team, BCRTC management and supervisors.

Business Intelligence & Analytics (BI&A) Services

Provides analytical services as requested from leaders across the organization on divisional and departmental level BI&A reporting, business process digitization and automation. Ensures end users have the information needed to manage their business performance to support a culture of continuous improvement.

Designs, implements, and maintains end-to-end analytical solutions for BCRTC internal clients using modern BI platforms such as Microsoft Azure Synapse, Fabric, PowerApp, PowerAutomate, and Power BI. Ensures designed solutions are fit for purpose, cost-effective, align with standards, policies and support ongoing data & insights-driven initiatives within BCRTC. Ensures that solutions are reusable and scalable following best practices, balancing immediate short-term and long-term benefits.

Processes sensitive workforce data and develops relevant BI solutions according to enterprise policies and guidelines. Supports the completion of requisite Privacy Impact Assessment (PIA) completion for the developed data and analytics solutions.

Qualifications

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:

The requirements for this job are acquired through completion of a bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Data Management, Data Analytics, Engineering, or other relevant business-related fields plus four (4) years of experience with development and analysis of performance measurements, and technical experience with design, implementation and maintenance of data and creation of reports in a Business Intelligence environment. Master’s, Doctorate degrees, and Professional Certifications in related fields may be considered as equivalent to practical experience. Experience supporting data management or data governance programs, or in workforce-related analytics for occupational health, safety, workforce productivity and other HR analytics would be considered an asset.

Other Requirements

Solid understanding of concepts, principles, practices and techniques pertaining to all aspects of performance measures, benchmarking, balanced scorecards and dashboards.

Advanced knowledge of developing Microsoft Analytics solutions including PowerApps, Power Automate, Power BI, Azure Synapse and Fabric. Demonstrated experience in programming languages is required: e.g. SQL, R, Python.

Strong analytical, problem solving and judgment skills to be able to interpret data and diagnose data quality issues.

Strong time management, organization, verbal and written communication skills

Strong relationship management skills and ability to work across multidisciplinary teams and management levels

Ability to multi-task, manage multiple priorities and work in a rapidly changing and dynamic environment with limited supervision

Ability to listen and interpret stakeholder feedback to understand business processes and identify business issues/objectives.

Other Information

Recruitment Process: An applicant will be required to demonstrate their suitability for this position by meeting the minimum level of qualifications and experience in order to be invited into the selection process. A standard interview format will be used including general, scenario and behavioural descriptive interview questions.

Work Schedule

37.5 hours per week.

Work Designation

Resident

This position works predominately on-site.

Rate of Pay

Salary: $75,600 - $113,400 per annum (Actual salary offered will be commensurate with education, experience and internal parity).

The Total Compensation Package includes Extended Health, Dental, Transit Pass and enrollment in the Public Service Pension Plan. Focus on your development through tuition reimbursement, training, and mentorship programs. Enjoy a variety of health and wellness programs, including access to gym facilities. Speak to us to know more about what we offer.

How To Apply

Please click the 'Apply' button at the top right corner or go to http://www.translink.ca/careers to apply for this position and view instructions on the process.

INSTRUCTIONS: Please save your (1) cover letter, and your (2) resume as one pdf document prior to uploading your application on-line.

Posting Date: January 09, 2025

Closing Date: Open Until Filled

Please note that only those short listed will be contacted.

Having trouble applying? Please view the System Requirements & FAQ's by going to http://www.translink.ca/careers.

Equal Employment Opportunity

SkyTrain is committed to employment equity and building a diverse workforce, representative of the customers we serve and the many communities in the Metro Vancouver region. We welcome and encourage Indigenous applicants, people of colour, all genders, 2SLGBTQ+ and persons with disabilities to apply. Learn more about TransLink's commitment to to equity, diversity and inclusion.

Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. For a confidential inquiry, simply email us at jobs@translink.ca.
Show more
HTML:
Marketing Statement

Join a company that has been a part of moving Metro Vancouver for over 35 years.

British Columbia Rapid Transit Company Ltd. (BCRTC) maintains and operates the Expo and Millennium SkyTrain Lines from our central facilities in south Burnaby. Our services connect downtown Vancouver to the cities of Burnaby, New Westminster, Coquitlam, Port Moody and Surrey. With the future expansion of both the Expo and Millennium Lines gathering pace, infrastructure renewal and new asset acquisition projects underway, this is an exciting time to join our team of over 1,200 dedicated employees, working on one of the longest fully-automated rapid transit systems in the world.

Our work encompasses roles such as administration, engineering, elevator and escalator maintenance, field operations, vehicle maintenance, and wayside (station and guideway) maintenance.

When you work for SkyTrain, not only will you help move Metro Vancouver, you will also have access to comprehensive benefits including paid vacation, medical benefits, transit passes, training and more. We are a proud equal opportunity employer, committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce.

Come explore what makes us one of BC’s Top Employers!

Title: Jr. Analyst, Client Services Intern (Hybrid)
Description:
At Broadridge, we've built a culture where the highest goal is to empower others to accomplish more. If you’re passionate about developing your career, while helping others along the way, come join the Broadridge team.

At Broadridge, we've built a culture where the highest goal is to empower others to accomplish more. If you’re passionate about developing your career while helping others along the way, come join the Broadridge team.

We are currently seeking a Jr. Analyst Intern, Client Services to join our dynamic team. This internship offers a unique opportunity to gain hands-on experience in shaping the future of technology solutions while working on impactful projects. You will play a key role in driving data transformation, analytics, and internal productivity initiatives that directly influence decision-making and operational excellence.

Summer Internship: May 2025 - August 2025

Key Job Functions/Responsibilities


Design and implement internal productivity tools to enhance team effectiveness, including developing applications using programming languages like Python or JavaScript
Conduct data cleaning, transformation, and visualization projects to improve data accuracy and provide actionable insights for senior management, leveraging tools like PowerBI and ChatGPT
Analyze Client Services data to identify patterns and trends that inform service improvements or future product offerings
Assist in maintaining and creating documentation on Confluence to ensure knowledge-sharing and process standardization across teams
Collaborate with internal stakeholders to understand business challenges and propose data-driven solutions
Partner closely with the development team to guide and prioritize assigned development initiatives
Support the creation of training materials and user guides to drive efficiency and adoption of new tools


Basic Skill Level Requirements

Education:


Currently enrolled in a 2nd or 3rd year University Degree or College Diploma program in Computer Science, Business Administration, or a related field


Technical Skills/Tools:


Proficiency in the MS Office Suite: Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Visio
Proficiency in PowerBI or similar data visualization tools is an asset
Experience with SQL, Python, Java, or JavaScript; familiarity with Large Language Models (LLMs) is a plus
Knowledge of design principles, data modeling, process modeling, wireframes, and prototyping


Personal Skills:


Strong analytical skills with attention to detail and a problem-solving mindset
Effective communication skills, including business writing, presentations, and stakeholder engagement
Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to build consensus, negotiate, and collaborate cross-functionally
A proactive and curious mindset with a strong desire to learn and contribute meaningfully to the team
Ability to work independently on projects, with tight deadlines, under minimal supervision Demonstrated experience in project coordination or a similar role
Ability to adapt to changing priorities and work effectively in a fast-paced environment


Recruitment Process

Throughout your application process, you may be asked to connect with us virtually or in-person. Our recruiters will explain how hybrid interviews will be held throughout the recruitment process, and they will be able to answer any questions you might have.

Background Check Process

Broadridge requires employees to complete a background check that is completed by one of our service providers. We use this service to complete the following checks:


Employment verification
Education verification
Credit inquiry
Canadian criminal record check


Workplace Flexibility

We are committed to supporting flexible work arrangements, investing in technology or other resources to enable you to work from home effectively, wherever possible.

At this time this is a hybrid role, and therefore you should have a basic home office set up, high-speed internet, and the ability to work without distractions during core business hours.

Accessibility & Accommodation

Broadridge is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace ensuring that equal employment opportunities are provided to all individuals, regardless of race, colour, gender identity, sexual orientation, marital status, creed, age, disability, religious affiliation, or national origin or citizenship. If you require any accommodations during the recruitment process, please notify our recruitment team.

Broadridge associates helped us envision our Connected Workplace - a work model that allows associates around the globe, dependent upon their role responsibilities, take advantage of the benefits of both on-site and off-site work to support our clients, one another, and the communities where we live and work. Our Connected Workplace is grounded in the concept of FACS: Flexible, Accountable, Connected, and Supported, which is our commitment to our associates. FACS supports our strong culture and allows us to achieve business goals while supporting meaningful work-life integration for our associates.

We are dedicated to fostering a diverse, equitable, and inclusive environment and committed to providing a workplace that empowers associates to be authentic and bring their best to work. We believe that associates can only do their best when they feel safe, understood, and valued, and we work diligently and collaboratively to ensure Broadridge is a company—and ultimately a community—that recognizes and celebrates diversity in all its dimensions.


Show more

Title: Online Data Analyst
Description:
We are hiring freelance English and French speaking Online Data Analysts for a project aimed at improving the content and quality of digital maps, which are used by millions of users globally. The job would suit someone who is detail-oriented, likes doing research and has a good knowledge of national and local geography.

This is a freelance position on a flexible schedule - you can work in your own time whenever work is available. You will be completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment, e.g., verifying and comparing data, determining the relevance and accuracy of information. You will be provided with guidelines for each task, which need to be followed. The project offers a variety of tasks, and work is paid per task.

Requirements

Full Professional Proficiency in English and French
You must be living in Canada the last 2 consecutive years
Ability to follow guidelines and do research online using search engines, online maps and website information
You must have familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media and cultural affairs in Canada
Being open to work across a diverse set of Task Types (e.g. Maps, News, Audio tasks, Relevance)
Applicants must be 18 years or over.

Working on this project will require you to go through a standard recruitment process (including passing an open book assessment). This is a long-term project and your work will occasionally be subject to quality assurance checks.

Why Join the TELUS Digital Community?

Earn additional income with flexible hours to fit your lifestyle
Better work-life balance
Be your own boss
Complimentary Well-Being package encompassing a wealth of well-being resources.
Be part of an online community







TELUS Digital partners with a diverse and vibrant community to help our customers enhance their AI and machine learning models. The work of our AI Community contributes to improving technology and the digital experiences of many people around the world. Our AI Community works in our proprietary AI training platform handling all data types (text, images, audio, video and geo) across 500+ languages and dialects. We offer flexible work-from-home opportunities for people with passion for languages. The jobs are part-time, and there is no fixed schedule. Whoever you are, wherever you come from, come join our global AI community. https://telusdigital.com

Show more

HTML:
We are hiring freelance English speaking Online Data Analysts for a project aimed at improving the content and quality of digital maps, which are used by millions of users globally. The job would suit someone who is detail-oriented, likes doing research and has a good knowledge of national and local geography.

This is a freelance position on a flexible schedule - you can work in your own time whenever work is available. You will be completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment, e.g., verifying and comparing data, determining the relevance and accuracy of information. You will be provided with guidelines for each task, which need to be followed. The project offers a variety of tasks, and work is paid per task.

Requirements

  • Full Professional Proficiency in English
  • You must be living in Canada the last 2 consecutive years
  • Ability to follow guidelines and do research online using search engines, online maps and website information
  • You must have familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media and cultural affairs in Canada
  • Being open to work across a diverse set of Task Types (e.g. Maps, News, Audio tasks, Relevance)
  • Applicants must be 18 years or over.

Working on this project will require you to go through a standard recruitment process (including passing an open book assessment). This is a long-term project and your work will occasionally be subject to quality assurance checks.

Why Join the TELUS Digital Community?

  • Earn additional income with flexible hours to fit your lifestyle
  • Better work-life balance
  • Be your own boss
  • Complimentary Well-Being package encompassing a wealth of well-being resources.
  • Be part of an online community



TELUS Digital partners with a diverse and vibrant community to help our customers enhance their AI and machine learning models. The work of our AI Community contributes to improving technology and the digital experiences of many people around the world. Our AI Community works in our proprietary AI training platform handling all data types (text, images, audio, video and geo) across 500+ languages and dialects. We offer flexible work-from-home opportunities for people with passion for languages. The jobs are part-time, and there is no fixed schedule. Whoever you are, wherever you come from, come join our global AI community. https://telusdigital.com

Title: Project Analyst
Description:
Join us in our mission to commercialize fusion energy ⚡️

We’re all about solving climate change through fusion energy, one stellarator at a time. Our impressive team of globally recognized fusion scientists along with veteran business leaders with experienced in scaling energy technologies, came together with the ambition to fulfill the bold decadal vision of commercial fusion.

If changing the world wasn’t incentive enough, here’s why you should join us:

We designed, built, and operated the world’s leading stellarators.

We aim to commercialize fusion energy in 10 years.

We know what we’re doing - our leadership team has over 150 years of experience combined.

We’ve already been recognised for our work by the Department of Energy through awards and funding.

Our philosophy accepts no intellectual boundaries and celebrates creativity.

Company: Type One Energy Group - Canada, Inc.

Job Title: Project Analyst

NOC: 11201 – Professional occupations in business management consulting

Offered Wage: $43.00 – 45.00/hour (based on a 40-hour workweek) - permanent/full-time

Work Location: 1140 West Pender St., Vancouver, BC V6E 4G1 Canada

Number of Positions: One (1)

Required Language Skills: English (spoken & written)

About Us

Type One Energy Group is mission-driven to provide sustainable, affordable fusion power to the world. Established in 2019 and venture-backed in 2023, the company is led by a team of globally recognized fusion scientists with a strong track record of building state-of-the-art stellarator fusion machines, together with veteran business leaders experienced in scaling companies and commercializing energy technologies. Type One Energy applies proven advanced manufacturing methods, modern computational physics and high-field superconducting magnets to develop its optimized stellarator fusion energy system.

Our FusionDirect development program pursues the lowest-risk, shortest-schedule path to a fusion power plant over the coming decade, using a partner-intensive and capital-efficient strategy. We are committed to diversity, inclusion, and equitable access to clean energy. For more information, visit www.typeoneenergy.com or follow us on LinkedIn.

Job Summary

The Project Analyst will play a pivotal role in supporting Type One Energy's mission to revolutionize energy production by managing complex projects within the fusion energy sector. The successful candidate will oversee project schedules, budgets, and risk management, leveraging data-driven insights to optimize project performance. This role requires advanced skills in automation, statistical analysis, and specialized project management tools, with a focus on driving operational efficiency and continuous improvement across multiple projects.

Key Responsibilities


Develop and maintain project schedules, budgets, and deliverables for complex, high-stakes projects within the fusion energy sector.
Create and manage risk registers, conduct FMEA risk assessments, and implement risk mitigation strategies using tools like LogicGate and RiskyProject.
Utilize advanced statistical methods and programming languages (e.g., Python, MATLAB, SQL) to analyze project data and optimize key performance metrics. Design custom dashboards in PowerBI for real-time project monitoring.
Automate project processes using tools such as Power Automate, PowerApps, and custom scripts (e.g., JavaScript/Apps Script/Power Fx). Develop automated systems for documentation, purchasing, and other operational workflows.
Configure and manage project management tools (e.g., Primavera P6, JIRA, Smartsheet) to meet project requirements and enhance team collaboration. Integrate these tools with platforms like Confluence and SharePoint.
Oversee the timecard system tailored to the organization’s needs. Ensure accurate and timely entry of employee work hours, monitor data quality, trouble soot discrepancies, and resolve issue promptly.
Develop and customize reports to meet specific departmental needs or management requests, such as cost tracking, schedule health check
Lead initiatives to improve project management processes, gather team feedback, and implement enhancements based on data analysis.


Required Skills

The successful candidate must have:


A minimum of 2 years of experience in the fusion energy sector or a related high-technology industry, with expertise in managing complex technical projects and understanding project management practices specific to engineering or energy-related fields.
At least 2 years of experience in advanced Excel, with expertise in data management and analysis, complex formulas and calculations, pivot tables and charts, data automation and Validation.
At least 2 years of experience using advanced project management software, including Primavera P6, JIRA, LogicGate, and Smartsheet, with demonstrated capability in configuring these tools to meet project requirements.
At least 2 years of experience in automating workflows using tools such as Power Automate, PowerApps, or custom scripts (e.g., JavaScript/Apps Script).
At least 2 years of experience in data analysis using programming languages like Python, MATLAB, or SQL, with proficiency in creating data visualization dashboards using PowerBI.
At least 2 years of experience in risk management, including performing FMEA risk assessments, developing risk mitigation strategies, and managing risk registers for high-stakes projects.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to lead process improvement initiatives and train team members on specialized tools and techniques.


Required Education


Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Project Management, Data Science, or a related field.


Benefits


Bonus (if applicable):
Disability Insurance
Dental Insurance
RRSP with up to 4% company match
Extended Medical Insurance (e.g. prescription drugs, paramedical services, medical services and equipment)
Vacation Days – 12 Holidays & 15 Days PTO
Any additional benefits offered:
Company Shares

How To Apply

Please send your resume to the following email address: careers@typeoneenergy.com. We ask that the candidates put "Project Analyst" in the email subject line when they apply so that it's easily identifiable. We thank you for applying, however, only those selected to continue will be contacted.

Equal Opportunity Statement

Type One Energy is an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity, searching for the best new ideas and remaining open to unique perspectives. Therefore, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment independent of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, age, or any other characteristics protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws. All qualified individuals are encouraged to apply.

Type One Energy Group is mission-driven to provide sustainable, affordable fusion power to the world. The company was formed in 2019 by a team of globally-recognized fusion scientists with a strong track record of building state-of-art stellarator fusion machines, together with veteran business leaders experienced in scaling companies and commercializing energy technologies.

Type One Energy applies proven advanced manufacturing methods, modern computational physics and high-field superconducting magnets to develop its optimized stellarator fusion energy system. Its FusionDirect development program pursues the lowest-risk, shortest-schedule path to a fusion power plant over the coming decade, using a partner-intensive and capital-efficient strategy.

For more information, visit https://www.typeoneenergy.com/.

Title: Data Governance and Business Intelligence Analyst (15 month contract)
Description:
As an integral part of BCMEA’s Data Analytics program, the Data Governance and Business Intelligence Analyst designs and delivers robust reporting and analytical solutions to drive BCMEA’s ongoing evolution towards a data-driven decision-making culture. This role harnesses data analysis techniques support a centralized IT service desk, and collaborates with diverse stakeholders to continue the develop the maturity of BCMEA’s Data Governance Program. This position is a 15 month contract, and a dedicated resource to the WaterfrontWorks initiative, which is a 7-element technology program focused on improving our workforce planning tools.




Responsibilities

Service Desk: Respond to requests for data pulls, analyses, report distribution changes, new dashboards, etc. including coordination with business or IT teams as necessary.
Optimize Reporting Data: Collaborate with stakeholders to draft changes to BI reports, incorporating insights from data discovery to enhance reporting formats.
Prototyping: Prototype and perform tasks for BI enhancements, ensuring alignment with organizational goals and data architecture standards.
Data Analysis Optimization: Facilitate the handover of analyzed data to data scientists for further modeling and to data engineers for pipeline development and implementation.
Utilization of Tools: Utilize Power BI and SQL skills for developing and troubleshooting BI solutions, including DAX creation, query optimization, and semantic model building, to support actionable insights.
Liaise and Coordinate: Liaise with team members and stakeholders to understand analytical solution requirements, including assessing inefficiencies in existing business applications and future business needs.
Data Governance: Primary support for the Data Governance Program lead. Influence the Data Governance Roadmap in alignment with the needs of the BCMEA and its customers, and lead the implementation of related tools and software.
Reporting and Dashboarding: Develop reports and dashboards using data visualization best practices and organizational report templates, ensuring usability and standardization while meeting Data Analytics program standards.
Designing: Design, maintain, and optimize analytics products, data models, dashboards, and reports using business intelligence tools such as Power BI, and Power BI Report Builder.
Innovation and Improvement: Continuously explore opportunities to enhance data collection and reporting processes to efficiently fulfill stakeholder needs.
Monitor and Review: Regularly review report and dashboard usage metrics, proactively engaging with users to address low usage issues and make necessary adjustments.
Data Accuracy: Conduct data quality validation and assurance audits to uphold ongoing data completeness and accuracy.
Data Enablement: Deliver relevant insights promptly to support informed decision-making and address ad hoc requests effectively.
Data Translation: Collaborate with data scientists and engineers to translate business requirements into technical solutions, ensuring alignment with organizational objectives.
Industry Trends and Advancements: Stay updated with the latest tools, techniques, and trends in data analytics and business intelligence through continuous learning and skill development.




Qualifications

3 to 5 years of experience in Business Intelligence and Data Governance with a Bachelors degree, diploma or certificate in any related field.
Technically proficient in Microsoft Office (Excel & PowerPoint), BI Tools (Power BI & Power BI Report Builder) for data visualization and storytelling, and Data Tools (SQL & Python is a bonus).
Proven work experience extracting, manipulating, and analyzing complex information, like report requirements, using multiple data sources and systems.
Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to effectively communicate and present to diverse audiences.
Versed understanding of data governance principles (e.g., data quality, data literacy, and data security).
You are organized, solutions-driven and passionate about data.
Collaborate effectively in a team environment by fostering open communication and idea-sharing and engaging with various stakeholders effectively.
Critical thinking and analytical abilities to support decision-making processes, interpret data insights and drive actionable recommendations.
You can effectively evaluate situations and propose innovative solutions when necessary. 
Change management certification looked upon favourably




About Us

The British Columbia Maritime Employers Association (BCMEA) represents 49 member companies which consists of ship owners, bulk operators, stevedores, general cargo and containers, and the more than 8,500 employees who work for them. We are integral to Canada’s Pacific Gateway Strategy that links Canada to the rest of the world. This gateway contributes $12 billion dollars and 130,000 direct and indirect jobs to Canada’s economy.

Our head office is located in up and coming Railtown. Close to transit and just minutes away from Gastown and Chinatown. Free parking is available in our designated lot to those who drive. Our office features beautiful exposed brick and modern workstations in an open environment.

BC Maritime Employers Association is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workforce and welcome applications from candidates of all backgrounds.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Our story

We’re a fast growing, Series A stage health AI company building a clinical operating system for MSK practices. We are revenue generating and are looking to carefully expand the team to help us scale to 1,000,000 patients and beyond!

The team is headquartered in NYC with a satellite office in Vancouver, BC. Much of our engineering team is remote - distributed throughout the US and Canada.

We live in Notion docs, Slack channels and Github with weekly meetings over Zoom. Meetings may feature honorary advisors, MedTech execs, and, if we’re lucky, Will’s cat or our Chief Pup Officer.

As Flagler continues to grow, there is a unique opportunity to build the foundations of data and infrastructure to help the product and company reach our full potential. This is where you come in — to design and build reliable, trusted, and timely analytics that accelerate the decision-making process of key product and business functions. You will have a strong impact on the roadmap and growth trajectory of our company.

What You Will Do


Develop LLM and other ML-based approaches for chart abstraction from both unstructured and structured healthcare data.
Design, build, deploy, and improve machine learning models for operational analytics to help us optimize clinical operations
Design and develop Reinforcement Learning models that leverage physician feedback and patient outcomes to continuously improve clinical performance and AI safety


Required Qualifications


Research, develop, and productionize LLM-powered machine learning methods for extracting insights from longitudinal clinical data (both unstructured and structured).
Design, build, deploy, and improve machine learning models for operational analytics to help us optimize clinical operations
Design and develop Reinforcement Learning models that leverage physician feedback and patient outcomes to continuously improve clinical performance and AI safety
Proven experience in data science, including a proven track record of successful projects in healthcare or operation analytics
Strong programming skills in Python, and fluency with modern data science and ML/NLP libraries (PyTorch, HuggingFace, etc.).
Knowledge of both statistical and modern deep learning (e.g. transformer) techniques and architectures.


Hiring Process

Due to the high volume of applications, we only reach out to candidates selected for interviews. We do not have online leetcode assessments as an initial filter, so we only reach out to very few candidates for initial introduction.

Title: Data Analyst - Senior
Description:
At Lumenalta, we create impactful software solutions that drive innovation and transform businesses. Since 2000, we’ve partnered with visionary leaders to build cutting-edge tech, solve complex challenges, and deliver results faster through our elite teams and tech-driven approach. Join us in shaping the future of technology.




What we're working on:

Enterprise companies turn to us to help them launch innovative digital products that interact with hundreds of millions of customers, transactions and data points. The problems we solve daily are real and require creativity, grit and determination. We are building a culture that challenges norms while fostering experimentation and personal growth. To grasp the scale of problems we face, ideally, you have some exposure to Logistics, FinTech, Transportation, Insurance, Media or other complex multifactor industries.




Responsibilities

Design and build visually impactful dashboards and reports using Power BI and Tableau.
Migrate and integrate legacy Tableau systems into Power BI, ensuring consistency and usability.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business needs and translate them into data solutions.
Analyze large datasets to identify trends, opportunities, and actionable insights.
Ensure data quality and accuracy through thorough validation and testing.




Requirements

7+ years experience as a data analyst.
Expertise in Power BI and Tableau (experience with both is ideal; proficiency in at least one is required).
Strong understanding of data visualization best practices.
Proficiency in SQL for querying and managing datasets.
Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, in English.
Industry experience in Financial Services is a plus.
Personality traits: detail-oriented, proactive, problem solver, collaborative, passionate about data.




Why Lumenalta is an amazing place to work at

At Lumenalta, you can expect that you will:

Be 100% dedicated to one project at a time so that you can innovate and grow.
Be a part of a team of talented and friendly senior-level developers.
Work on projects that allow you to use leading tech.




The result? We produce meaningful outcomes for our clients that break barriers in their industries.




The job is 100% Remote; please ensure you have a comfortable office set at your desired work location.




Lumenalta is committed to hiring exceptional talent from a wide variety of diverse backgrounds. If you share our values and enthusiasm for digital transformation, we encourage you to apply

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Vancity is the largest private sector Living Wage Employer in Canada and have been consistently recognized as one of the Top Employers in Canada. Come join our team of 2,600 diverse individuals and access competitive rewards & benefits, all while knowing you are a part of a greater movement.

As a Data Engineer, you’d be involved in projects and work with the team to achieve high quality data integrations and responsible for design and development of scalable data solutions.

This is a full-time, permanent role. This competitively rewarded role will enjoy hybrid working arrangements which can be fulfilled primarily from the Vancity head office location and your Lower Mainland based home office. Periodically, in-person events or activities will be required of you.

This is your chance to contribute to the ongoing Data Platform enhancements to support strategic business initiatives. Grab the opportunity by applying now.

A Typical Day Would Involve


Design and build efficient & reliable data pipelines, cleanse, and normalize diverse datasets for Analytics.
Troubleshoot and resolve problems of data services that support business & applications systems and provide solutions to pro-actively prevent problems from happening.
Create and manage knowledgebase, access controls, deployment pipeline architecture and infrastructure related to Data Platform.
Help drive transformation by continuously looking for ways to automate existing processes and optimize for efficiency and data quality, redesigning infrastructure for greater scalability, etc
Represent team as an subject matter expert for strategic projects and contribute to end-to-end data architecture solutions.


You Are


Customer-centric: You define and measure success through the eyes of your internal customers and anticipate, understand and respond to their evolving needs. Demonstrate strong follow through and consistently keep commitments to members and team.
Results-oriented: You have a demonstrated ability to engage stakeholders to elicit requirements, analyze findings, generate appropriate solutions, and build deliverables all while securing the team's commitment to these solutions.
Technology savvy: You have education and/or experience supporting technology development/implementation efforts.
Curious & innovative: You always do your research and analysis to assess and recommend a course of action based on industry, political and economic trends, you can identify risks and opportunities that may impact the business unit and or designated area.


You Have


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related technical discipline.
3+ years of industry experience in Data Engineering or related field handling data processing and transformation of disparate datasets
Experience with big data and analytics programming languages such as Python, R, Spark in Databricks
Experience with batch and real-time processing frameworks (EventHub, Apache Spark, Apache Kafka, etc.)
Willingness to work in a highly flexible environment with multiple competing priorities.
Proven ability to innovate and adapt to the latest development in area of expertise. Ability to adapt and grasp new skills and content.


Bonus Points, If You Have


Experience in design and implementation of data integrations in Azure data stack such as Azure Data Lake, Azure Data Factory, Azure Databricks, EventHub.
Exposure to DevSecOps practices to incorporate security first principles.
Good understanding of data storage, data mapping and modelling, real-time data handling


The team: In this role, you will report into Manager, Data Engineering

Salary Band: The salary range for the role is $81,200 to $122,000 and a candidate’s offer is likely to be up to the mid-point of the role $101,600. The upper half of the salary range is typically reserved for individuals who have demonstrated consistent strong performance in the role and possess a high level of job knowledge and skill.

Posting Deadline: Posted until filled

We Offer


We are the largest private-sector Living Wage Employer in Canada and have been consistently recognized as one of the Top Employers in Canada
Our permanent employees qualify for attractive benefit packages that can be customized and changed each year to meet their evolving needs
New employees receive between three and four weeks of vacation allowance per calendar year, and the number of vacation days grows — to a maximum of six weeks per year — as their length of service increases. In addition, full-time, permanent staff can purchase up to six extra days of vacation through our flexible benefits package.
In addition to the 10 statutory holidays in British Columbia, Vancity provides an additional three statutory holidays. We offer care days for periods of short-term personal illness or emergency family illness, plus opportunities to take unpaid leave for a variety of reasons.
We understand that retirement means different things to different people and at Vancity we offer retirement programs to meet diverse needs


At Vancity we’re committed to creating a welcoming and inclusive workplace to help our people and communities thrive and prosper. Diversity in our workforce is integral so that we can truly represent, understand and respond to our community needs and deliver on our member experience. As part of this commitment we are taking action to learn more about our applicants and ask that you complete a short and anonymous Diversity Survey that will influence the design and execution of Vancity’s overall DEI initiatives and programs, one of which aims to advance our commitment to become a financial force for change and build a fair world. Please click this hyperlink to complete the Diversity Survey. Your responses are collected anonymously and will never be linked to your job application.

Please note that all shortlisted candidates for this role will be required to complete a background check which includes resume verification, credit check, criminal record check. Vancity is an inclusive and equitable employer and actively seeks to advance racial equity, inclusion and belonging across the organization. Vancity offers required accommodations in all stages of the recruitment process. If you require an accommodation, please advise us, and we will work with you to meet your needs.
